[x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Case Handling\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n### Testing Requirements\n- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n\n### Code Quality\n- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n\n---\n\n## 5. Implementation Guidance\n\n### Execution Layers\n\n**Layer 0 — Foundation:**\n1. Create project structure (`src/todo_cli/`, `tests/`)\n2. Create `pyproject.toml` with dependencies and entry point\n3. Create `src/todo_cli/__init__.py`\n4. Initialize uv project and sync dependencies\n\n**Layer 1 — Core Implementation:**\n1. Implement `cli.py` with Click commands\n2. Implement JSON storage functions (load/save)\n3. Implement each command: add, list, complete, delete\n\n**Layer 2 — Testing:**\n1. Create `test_cli.py` with CliRunner tests\n2. Write tests for happy paths\n3. Write tests for edge cases\n\n**Layer 3 — Validation:**\n1. Run all tests\n2. Run linter\n3. Manual verification of CLI commands\n\n### Expected Artifacts\n\n| File | Purpose |\n|------|---------|\n| `pyproject.toml` | Package config, dependencies, entry point |\n| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init with version |\n| `src/todo_cli/cli.py` | Main CLI implementation |\n| `tests/test_cli.py` | Test suite with 10+ tests |\n\n### Constraints\n\n**DO:**\n- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory\n- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n- Create extra files beyond requirements\n- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n\n### pyproject.toml Template\n```toml\n[project]\nname = \"todo-cli\"\nversion = \"0.1.0\"\ndescription = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\nrequires-python = \">=3.11\"\ndependencies = [\n    \"click>=8.0\",\n]\n\n[project.scripts]\ntodo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n\n[build-system]\nrequires = [\"hatchling\"]\nbuild-backend = \"hatchling.build\"\n\n[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]\npackages = [\"src/todo_cli\"]\n\n[dependency-groups]\ndev = [\n    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n]\n```\n\n---\n\n## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n\n### Test Categories Required\n\n**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n\n**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n\n### Test Pattern with Click\n```python\nfrom click.testing import CliRunner\nfrom todo_cli.cli import cli\nimport tempfile\nimport os\n\ndef test_add_todo():\n    runner = CliRunner()\n    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n        assert result.exit_code == 0\n        assert 'Added' in result.output\n```\n\n### Test Isolation\n- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n- Each test must be independent\n\n---\n\n## 6. Verification and Traceability\n\n### Self-Verification Checklist\n\nBefore marking complete, verify:\n\n**Commands:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"Test task\"` → Adds task, shows confirmation\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[ ]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 1` → Shows completion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[x]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 1` → Shows deletion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Edge Cases:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"\"` → Error message, exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n\n**Tests:**\n- [ ] `uv run pytest` → All tests pass\n- [ ] Test count >= 10\n\n**Linting:**\n- [ ] `uv run ruff check src/ tests/` → No errors\n\n### Traceability Matrix\n\n| Requirement | Implementation | Test |\n|-------------|----------------|------|\n| add command | cli.py:add() | test_add_todo |\n| list command | cli.py:list() | test_list_todos |\n| complete command | cli.py:complete() | test_complete_todo |\n| delete command | cli.py:delete() | test_delete_todo |\n| --help | Click automatic | N/A |\n| JSON storage | load_todos/save_todos | test_persistence |\n| Empty description error | add() validation | test_add_empty_description |\n| Invalid ID error | complete()/delete() | test_complete_invalid_id, test_delete_invalid_id |\n| Empty list message | list() | test_list_empty |\n\n---\n\n## 7. Reasoning Boundaries\n\n### Follow These Patterns\n- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n\n### Do Not Over-Engineer\n- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n\n### When Uncertain\n- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n\n---\n\n## Summary\n\nBuild a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence. Four commands (add, list, complete, delete) plus help. Store todos in `todos.json` with id/description/completed/created_at fields. Handle errors gracefully with exit code 1. Write 10+ pytest tests covering happy paths and edge cases. Use uv for package management.\n","numLines":340,"startLine":1,"totalLines":340}}}

This is the main implementation task that creates all business logic.\n     6→\n     7→## Context Reference\n     8→**For complete environment context, see:**\n     9→- `../AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n    10→\n    11→**Task-Specific Context:**\n    12→- Files to create:\n    13→  - `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation with all commands\n    14→- Patterns to follow:\n    15→  - Click CLI pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n    16→  - JSON storage pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n    17→  - Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n    18→- Commands to implement:\n    19→  - `add <description>` - Add new todo with auto-increment ID\n    20→  - `list` - Display all todos with checkbox format\n    21→  - `complete <id>` - Mark todo as completed\n    22→  - `delete <id>` - Remove todo from storage\n    23→\n    24→## Complexity\n    25→Medium\n    26→\n    27→## Dependencies\n    28→Depends on: TASK0\n    29→Blocks: TASK2, TASKΩ\n    30→Parallel with: None\n    31→\n    32→## Detailed Steps\n    33→1. Create `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n    34→2. Implement storage functions: `load_todos()`, `save_todos()`\n    35→3. Implement Click group with `@click.group()`\n    36→4. Implement `add` command with description argument\n    37→5. Implement `list` command (handles empty list)\n    38→6. Implement `complete` command with ID argument\n    39→7. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n    40→8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n    41→\n    42→## Acceptance Criteria\n    43→### Core Commands\n    44→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n    45→- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n    46→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n    47→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n    48→- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n    49→\n    50→### Data Persistence\n    51→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n    52→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n    53→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n    54→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n    55→\n    56→### Output Format\n    57→- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    58→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n    59→- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n    60→\n    61→### Edge Cases\n    62→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n    63→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    64→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    65→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n    66→\n    67→## Code Review Checklist\n    68→- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n    69→- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n    70→- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n    71→- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n    72→- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n    73→- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n    74→- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n    75→\n    76→## Reasoning Trace\n    77→This task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Splitting add/list/complete/delete into separate tasks would create unnecessary file conflicts and redundant setup. The Click pattern and JSON storage patterns are clearly provided in AI_PROMPT.md, so implementation should follow them exactly.\n    78→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"30539ff8-62d2-4a2f-a28a-710abaa77d7a","uuid":"7900b316-e803-413d-9bf6-acfdf441bb55","tool_use_result":{"type":"text","file":{"filePath":"/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK1/TASK.md","content":"@dependencies [TASK0]\n# Task: Core CLI Implementation\n\n## Summary\nImplement the complete CLI application with all four commands (add, list, complete, delete) using Click framework, plus JSON storage functions for data persistence. This is the main implementation task that creates all business logic.\n\n## Context Reference\n**For complete environment context, see:**\n- `../AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**Task-Specific Context:**\n- Files to create:\n  - `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation with all commands\n- Patterns to follow:\n  - Click CLI pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n  - JSON storage pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n  - Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n- Commands to implement:\n  - `add <description>` - Add new todo with auto-increment ID\n  - `list` - Display all todos with checkbox format\n  - `complete <id>` - Mark todo as completed\n  - `delete <id>` - Remove todo from storage\n\n## Complexity\nMedium\n\n## Dependencies\nDepends on: TASK0\nBlocks: TASK2, TASKΩ\nParallel with: None\n\n## Detailed Steps\n1. Create `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n2. Implement storage functions: `load_todos()`, `save_todos()`\n3. Implement Click group with `@click.group()`\n4. Implement `add` command with description argument\n5. Implement `list` command (handles empty list)\n6. Implement `complete` command with ID argument\n7. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n### Core Commands\n- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n\n### Data Persistence\n- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n\n### Output Format\n- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Cases\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n## Code Review Checklist\n- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n## Reasoning Trace\nThis task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Splitting add/list/complete/delete into separate tasks would create unnecessary file conflicts and redundant setup. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n    40→8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n    41→\n    42→## Acceptance Criteria\n    43→### Core Commands\n    44→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n    45→- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n    46→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n    47→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n    48→- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n    49→\n    50→### Data Persistence\n    51→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n    52→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n    53→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n    54→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n    55→\n    56→### Output Format\n    57→- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    58→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n    59→- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n    60→\n    61→### Edge Cases\n    62→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n    63→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    64→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    65→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n    66→\n    67→## Code Review Checklist\n    68→- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n    69→- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n    70→- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n    71→- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n    72→- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n    73→- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n    74→- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n    75→\n    76→## Reasoning Trace\n    77→This task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. code 1\n    55→- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    56→- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    57→\n    58→### Data Verification\n    59→- [ ] `todos.json` is created after first add\n    60→- [ ] Data persists after CLI exits\n    61→- [ ] JSON structure matches spec (id, description, completed, created_at)\n    62→\n    63→### Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n     3→\n     4→## COMPLEXITY\n     5→Medium\n     6→\n     7→## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n     8→**For complete environment context, read:**\n     9→- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n    10→\n    11→**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n    12→\n    13→## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n    14→\n    15→### Files This Task Will Create\n    16→- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n    17→\n    18→### Patterns to Follow\n    19→- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n    20→- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n    21→- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n    22→  ```python\n    23→  {\n    24→      \"id\": 1,\n    25→      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n    26→      \"completed\": False,\n    27→      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n    28→  }\n    29→  ```\n    30→\n    31→### Integration Points\n    32→- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n    33→- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n    34→- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n    35→\n    36→## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n    37→\n    38→### Command Specifications\n    39→\n    40→**`add <description>`**\n    41→- Argument: description (string)\n    42→- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n    43→- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n    44→- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n    45→\n    46→**`list`**\n    47→- No arguments\n    48→- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n    49→- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n    50→\n    51→**`complete <id>`**\n    52→- Argument: id (integer)\n    53→- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n    54→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    55→- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    56→\n    57→**`delete <id>`**\n    58→- Argument: id (integer)\n    59→- Remove todo from list\n    60→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    61→- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    62→\n    63→### Code Template\n    64→```python\n    65→import click\n    66→import json\n    67→import sys\n    68→from pathlib import Path\n    69→from datetime import datetime\n    70→\n    71→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    72→\n    73→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    74→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    75→        return []\n    76→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    77→\n    78→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    79→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    80→\n    81→@click.group()\n    82→def cli():\n    83→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    84→    pass\n    85→\n    86→@cli.command()\n    87→@click.argument('description')\n    88→def add(description: str) -> None:\n    89→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    90→    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n    91→\n    92→@cli.command('list')\n    93→def list_todos() -> None:\n    94→    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    95→    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n    96→\n    97→@cli.command()\n    98→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n    99→def complete(id: int) -> None:\n   100→    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n   101→    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n   102→\n   103→@cli.command()\n   104→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n   105→def delete(id: int) -> None:\n   106→    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n   107→    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n   108→\n   109→if __name__ == '__main__':\n   110→    cli()\n   111→```\n   112→\n   113→## LAYER\n   114→1\n   115→\n   116→## PARALLELIZATION\n   117→Parallel with: None\n   118→\n   119→## CONSTRAINTS\n   120→- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n   121→- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n   122→- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n   123→- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n   124→- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n   125→- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n   126→- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n   127→- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n   128→\n   129→## VALIDATION\n   130→After completion, verify manually:\n   131→```bash\n   132→uv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\n   133→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [ ] Test task\"\n   134→uv run todo complete 1                # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n   135→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [x] Test task\"\n   136→uv run todo delete 1                  # Should show \"Deleted todo: Test task\"\n   137→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"No todos yet\"\n   138→uv run todo add \"\"                    # Should error, exit 1\n   139→uv run todo complete 999              # Should show \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   140→```\n   141→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n\n## COMPLEXITY\nMedium\n\n## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n**For complete environment context, read:**\n- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n\n## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n\n### Files This Task Will Create\n- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n\n### Patterns to Follow\n- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n  ```python\n  {\n      \"id\": 1,\n      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n      \"completed\": False,\n      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n### Integration Points\n- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n\n## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n\n### Command Specifications\n\n**`add <description>`**\n- Argument: description (string)\n- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n\n**`list`**\n- No arguments\n- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n\n**`complete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n\n**`delete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Remove todo from list\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n### Code Template\n```python\nimport click\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n## LAYER\n1\n\n## PARALLELIZATION\nParallel with: None\n\n## CONSTRAINTS\n- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n\n## VALIDATION\nAfter completion, verify manually:\n```bash\nuv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\nuv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_017Am7DcbLRobb3rmaBfF2Ro","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→@dependencies [TASK0]\n     2→# Task: Core CLI Implementation\n     3→\n     4→## Summary\n     5→Implement the complete CLI application with all four commands (add, list, complete, delete) using Click framework, plus JSON storage functions for data persistence. This is the main implementation task that creates all business logic.\n     6→\n     7→## Context Reference\n     8→**For complete environment context, see:**\n     9→- `../AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n    10→\n    11→**Task-Specific Context:**\n    12→- Files to create:\n    13→  - `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation with all commands\n    14→- Patterns to follow:\n    15→  - Click CLI pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n    16→  - JSON storage pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n    17→  - Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n    18→- Commands to implement:\n    19→  - `add <description>` - Add new todo with auto-increment ID\n    20→  - `list` - Display all todos with checkbox format\n    21→  - `complete <id>` - Mark todo as completed\n    22→  - `delete <id>` - Remove todo from storage\n    23→\n    24→## Complexity\n    25→Medium\n    26→\n    27→## Dependencies\n    28→Depends on: TASK0\n    29→Blocks: TASK2, TASKΩ\n    30→Parallel with: None\n    31→\n    32→## Detailed Steps\n    33→1. Create `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n    34→2. Implement storage functions: `load_todos()`, `save_todos()`\n    35→3. Implement Click group with `@click.group()`\n    36→4. Implement `add` command with description argument\n    37→5. Implement `list` command (handles empty list)\n    38→6. Implement `complete` command with ID argument\n    39→7. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n    40→8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n    41→\n    42→## Acceptance Criteria\n    43→### Core Commands\n    44→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n    45→- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n    46→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n    47→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n    48→- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n    49→\n    50→### Data Persistence\n    51→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n    52→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n    53→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n    54→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n    55→\n    56→### Output Format\n    57→- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    58→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n    59→- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n    60→\n    61→### Edge Cases\n    62→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n    63→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    64→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    65→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n    66→\n    67→## Code Review Checklist\n    68→- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n    69→- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n    70→- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n    71→- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n    72→- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n    73→- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n    74→- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n    75→\n    76→## Reasoning Trace\n    77→This task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Splitting add/list/complete/delete into separate tasks would create unnecessary file conflicts and redundant setup. The Click pattern and JSON storage patterns are clearly provided in AI_PROMPT.md, so implementation should follow them exactly.\n    78→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"a8d18462-83cd-4afb-8a3a-4424bb7658c1","uuid":"2fff84a9-2f30-47d9-8804-2ec7be5f133d","tool_use_result":{"type":"text","file":{"filePath":"/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK1/TASK.md","content":"@dependencies [TASK0]\n# Task: Core CLI Implementation\n\n## Summary\nImplement the complete CLI application with all four commands (add, list, complete, delete) using Click framework, plus JSON storage functions for data persistence. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Cases\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n## Code Review Checklist\n- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n## Reasoning Trace\nThis task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    58→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n    59→- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n    60→\n    61→### Edge Cases\n    62→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n    63→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    64→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    65→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n    66→\n    67→## Code Review Checklist\n    68→- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n    69→- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n    70→- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n    71→- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n    72→- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n    73→- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n    74→- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n    75→\n    76→## Reasoning Trace\n    77→This task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Cases\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n## Code Review Checklist\n- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n## Reasoning Trace\nThis task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Implement `add` command:\n       - `@cli.command()` and `@click.argument('description')` decorators\n       - Validate non-empty description (if empty: `click.echo(\"Error: Description cannot be empty\")`, `sys.exit(1)`)\n       - Calculate next ID: `max(t['id'] for t in todos) + 1` or 1 if empty\n       - Create todo dict with id, description, completed=False, created_at (ISO 8601)\n       - Append to todos, save, output \"Added todo: {description}\"\n    8. Add `if __name__ == '__main__': cli()` at end\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:65-82` — Click CLI group pattern with decorators\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:85-98` — JSON storage pattern for load/save\n    - [ ] {description}`\n       - Use `click.echo()` for each line\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:129` — List output format specification\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:138` — Empty list message: \"No todos yet\"\n    - `PROMPT.md:47-49` — List command specification\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add list_todos command (~15 lines)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo list`\n    - Output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    - Empty list output: \"No todos yet\"\n    - Exit code: 0 (always succeeds)\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: After adding todo → shows `1. This is the main implementation task that creates all business logic.\n     6→\n     7→## Context Reference\n     8→**For complete environment context, see:**\n     9→- `../AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n    10→\n    11→**Task-Specific Context:**\n    12→- Files to create:\n    13→  - `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation with all commands\n    14→- Patterns to follow:\n    15→  - Click CLI pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n    16→  - JSON storage pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n    17→  - Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n    18→- Commands to implement:\n    19→  - `add <description>` - Add new todo with auto-increment ID\n    20→  - `list` - Display all todos with checkbox format\n    21→  - `complete <id>` - Mark todo as completed\n    22→  - `delete <id>` - Remove todo from storage\n    23→\n    24→## Complexity\n    25→Medium\n    26→\n    27→## Dependencies\n    28→Depends on: TASK0\n    29→Blocks: TASK2, TASKΩ\n    30→Parallel with: None\n    31→\n    32→## Detailed Steps\n    33→1. Create `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n    34→2. Implement storage functions: `load_todos()`, `save_todos()`\n    35→3. Implement Click group with `@click.group()`\n    36→4. Implement `add` command with description argument\n    37→5. Implement `list` command (handles empty list)\n    38→6. Implement `complete` command with ID argument\n    39→7. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n    40→8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n    41→\n    42→## Acceptance Criteria\n    43→### Core Commands\n    44→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n    45→- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n    46→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n    47→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n    48→- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n    49→\n    50→### Data Persistence\n    51→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n    52→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n    53→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n    54→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n    55→\n    56→### Output Format\n    57→- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    58→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n    59→- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n    60→\n    61→### Edge Cases\n    62→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n    63→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    64→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n    65→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n    66→\n    67→## Code Review Checklist\n    68→- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n    69→- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n    70→- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n    71→- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n    72→- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n    73→- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n    74→- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n    75→\n    76→## Reasoning Trace\n    77→This task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Splitting add/list/complete/delete into separate tasks would create unnecessary file conflicts and redundant setup. The Click pattern and JSON storage patterns are clearly provided in AI_PROMPT.md, so implementation should follow them exactly.\n    78→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. This is the main implementation task that creates all business logic.\n\n## Context Reference\n**For complete environment context, see:**\n- `../AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**Task-Specific Context:**\n- Files to create:\n  - `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation with all commands\n- Patterns to follow:\n  - Click CLI pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n  - JSON storage pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n  - Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n- Commands to implement:\n  - `add <description>` - Add new todo with auto-increment ID\n  - `list` - Display all todos with checkbox format\n  - `complete <id>` - Mark todo as completed\n  - `delete <id>` - Remove todo from storage\n\n## Complexity\nMedium\n\n## Dependencies\nDepends on: TASK0\nBlocks: TASK2, TASKΩ\nParallel with: None\n\n## Detailed Steps\n1. Create `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n2. Implement storage functions: `load_todos()`, `save_todos()`\n3. Implement Click group with `@click.group()`\n4. Implement `add` command with description argument\n5. Implement `list` command (handles empty list)\n6. Implement `complete` command with ID argument\n7. Implement `delete` command with ID argument\n8. Handle all error cases with exit code 1\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n### Core Commands\n- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n- [ ] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information\n\n### Data Persistence\n- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n\n### Output Format\n- [ ] List output: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Cases\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n## Code Review Checklist\n- [ ] Uses Click decorators: `@click.group()`, `@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`\n- [ ] Uses `click.echo()` for all output (not print)\n- [ ] Uses `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- [ ] Type hints on all functions\n- [ ] No unnecessary classes (dict is sufficient)\n- [ ] No extra features beyond spec (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n- [ ] ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n## Reasoning Trace\nThis task consolidates all CLI implementation because the commands are tightly coupled through shared storage functions. Splitting add/list/complete/delete into separate tasks would create unnecessary file conflicts and redundant setup. The Click pattern and JSON storage patterns are clearly provided in AI_PROMPT.md, so implementation should follow them exactly.\n","numLines":78,"startLine":1,"totalLines":78}}}

[x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n    49→- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n    50→\n    51→**`complete <id>`**\n    52→- Argument: id (integer)\n    53→- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n    54→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    55→- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    56→\n    57→**`delete <id>`**\n    58→- Argument: id (integer)\n    59→- Remove todo from list\n    60→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    61→- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    62→\n    63→### Code Template\n    64→```python\n    65→import click\n    66→import json\n    67→import sys\n    68→from pathlib import Path\n    69→from datetime import datetime\n    70→\n    71→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    72→\n    73→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    74→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    75→        return []\n    76→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    77→\n    78→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    79→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    80→\n    81→@click.group()\n    82→def cli():\n    83→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    84→    pass\n    85→\n    86→@cli.command()\n    87→@click.argument('description')\n    88→def add(description: str) -> None:\n    89→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    90→    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n    91→\n    92→@cli.command('list')\n    93→def list_todos() -> None:\n    94→    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    95→    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n    96→\n    97→@cli.command()\n    98→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n    99→def complete(id: int) -> None:\n   100→    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n   101→    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n   102→\n   103→@cli.command()\n   104→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n   105→def delete(id: int) -> None:\n   106→    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n   107→    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n   108→\n   109→if __name__ == '__main__':\n   110→    cli()\n   111→```\n   112→\n   113→## LAYER\n   114→1\n   115→\n   116→## PARALLELIZATION\n   117→Parallel with: None\n   118→\n   119→## CONSTRAINTS\n   120→- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n   121→- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n   122→- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n   123→- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n   124→- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n   125→- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n   126→- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n   127→- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n   128→\n   129→## VALIDATION\n   130→After completion, verify manually:\n   131→```bash\n   132→uv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\n   133→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [ ] Test task\"\n   134→uv run todo complete 1                # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n   135→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [x] Test task\"\n   136→uv run todo delete 1                  # Should show \"Deleted todo: Test task\"\n   137→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"No todos yet\"\n   138→uv run todo add \"\"                    # Should error, exit 1\n   139→uv run todo complete 999              # Should show \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   140→```\n   141→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n\n## COMPLEXITY\nMedium\n\n## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n**For complete environment context, read:**\n- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n\n## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n\n### Files This Task Will Create\n- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n\n### Patterns to Follow\n- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n  ```python\n  {\n      \"id\": 1,\n      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n      \"completed\": False,\n      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n### Integration Points\n- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n\n## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n\n### Command Specifications\n\n**`add <description>`**\n- Argument: description (string)\n- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n\n**`list`**\n- No arguments\n- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n\n**`complete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n\n**`delete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Remove todo from list\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n### Code Template\n```python\nimport click\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n## LAYER\n1\n\n## PARALLELIZATION\nParallel with: None\n\n## CONSTRAINTS\n- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n\n## VALIDATION\nAfter completion, verify manually:\n```bash\nuv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\nuv run todo list                      # Should show \"1.
