{"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_018fVW4nbarBRm2GADHa6t3d","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→# RESEARCH.md Generation Guide — Learn from the Codebase\n     2→\n     3→## 🎯 Purpose\n     4→\n     5→This document defines how step5 should generate RESEARCH.md files that help the agent leverage existing codebase patterns and components for consistency.\n     6→\n     7→**CRITICAL PRINCIPLE:** Don't reinvent the wheel. Find and learn from what already exists.\n     8→\n     9→---\n    10→\n    11→## 🔍 What RESEARCH.md Should Contain\n    12→\n    13→RESEARCH.md is the agent's **learning phase** before execution. It should answer:\n    14→\n    15→1. **What patterns already exist** that I can follow?\n    16→2. **What components can I reuse** instead of creating new ones?\n    17→3. **How have similar problems been solved** in this codebase?\n    18→4. **What are the integration points** and dependencies?\n    19→5. **What tests patterns exist** that I should follow?\n    20→\n    21→---\n    22→\n    23→## 📚 Research Methodology\n    24→\n    25→### Phase 1: Find Similar Implementations\n    26→\n    27→**Goal:** Locate code that solves similar problems to learn from.\n    28→\n    29→#### 1.1 Search Strategy\n    30→\n    31→```markdown\n    32→## Finding Similar Components\n    33→\n    34→**Search patterns to use:**\n    35→\n    36→1. **By functionality:**\n    37→   - Search for keywords from the task (e.g., \"validation\", \"parser\", \"handler\")\n    38→   - Look for similar feature names or concepts\n    39→   - Find related domain logic\n    40→\n    41→2. **By file patterns:**\n    42→   - If creating `user-service.ext`, search for `*-service.ext`\n    43→   - If creating `data-validator.ext`, search for `*-validator.ext`\n    44→   - Match naming conventions from the codebase\n    45→\n    46→3. **By architectural layer:**\n    47→   - Controllers: `src/controllers/**/*.ext`\n    48→   - Services: `src/services/**/*.ext`\n    49→   - Models: `src/models/**/*.ext`\n    50→   - Utils: `src/utils/**/*.ext`\n    51→   - Middleware: `src/middleware/**/*.ext`\n    52→\n    53→4. **By test patterns:**\n    54→   - Find test files for similar components\n    55→   - Look for test helpers and mocks\n    56→   - Understand testing approach (unit vs integration)\n    57→```\n    58→\n    59→#### 1.2 Analysis Depth\n    60→\n    61→For each similar component found, document:\n    62→\n    63→```markdown\n    64→## Similar Components Found\n    65→\n    66→### Component: `path/to/similar-component.ext`\n    67→- **Similarity:** [How it relates to your task]\n    68→- **Patterns to reuse:**\n    69→  - Line X-Y: [Pattern description]\n    70→  - Line A-B: [Another pattern]\n    71→- **Key learnings:**\n    72→  - Error handling approach at line Z\n    73→  - Validation pattern at line W\n    74→  - Dependencies used (imports)\n    75→  - Testing approach from `test-file.ext:lines`\n    76→\n    77→**Reuse decision:**\n    78→- [ ] Use as-is (import/extend)\n    79→- [ ] Adapt pattern\n    80→- [ ] Learn structure only\n    81→```\n    82→\n    83→---\n    84→\n    85→### Phase 2: Identify Reusable Components\n    86→\n    87→**Goal:** Find existing utilities, helpers, and libraries to leverage.\n    88→\n    89→#### 2.1 Common Reusable Patterns\n    90→\n    91→```markdown\n    92→## Reusable Components Checklist\n    93→\n    94→**Before creating new code, check if these exist:**\n    95→\n    96→- [ ] **Validation utilities:**\n    97→  - Search: `grep -r \"validate\" src/utils`\n    98→  - Search: `grep -r \"schema\" src/`\n    99→  - Common locations: `src/utils/validation.ext`, `src/validators/`\n   100→\n   101→- [ ] **Error handling:**\n   102→  - Search: `grep -r \"Error\" src/utils`\n   103→  - Search: `grep -r \"throw\" src/services`\n   104→  - Common locations: `src/utils/errors.ext`, `src/exceptions/`\n   105→\n   106→- [ ] **Data processing:**\n   107→  - Search: `grep -r \"transform\" src/utils`\n   108→  - Search: `grep -r \"format\" src/utils`\n   109→  - Common locations: `src/utils/formatters.ext`, `src/transformers/`\n   110→\n   111→- [ ] **Database/API helpers:**\n   112→  - Search: `grep -r \"query\" src/`\n   113→  - Search: `grep -r \"request\" src/`\n   114→  - Common locations: `src/db/`, `src/api/`, `src/services/`\n   115→\n   116→- [ ] **Authentication/Authorization:**\n   117→  - Search: `grep -r \"auth\" src/`\n   118→  - Search: `grep -r \"permission\" src/`\n   119→  - Common locations: `src/middleware/auth.ext`, `src/auth/`\n   120→\n   121→- [ ] **Configuration:**\n   122→  - Search: `config`, `.env`, `settings`\n   123→  - Common locations: `src/config/`, `.env.example`\n   124→\n   125→- [ ] **Logging:**\n   126→  - Search: `grep -r \"log\" src/`\n   127→  - Common locations: `src/utils/logger.ext`, `logger.js`\n   128→\n   129→- [ ] **Test utilities:**\n   130→  - Search: `grep -r \"mock\" __tests__`\n   131→  - Search: `grep -r \"helper\" __tests__`\n   132→  - Common locations: `__tests__/helpers/`, `__tests__/__mocks__/`\n   133→```\n   134→\n   135→#### 2.2 Document Reusable Components\n   136→\n   137→```markdown\n   138→## Reusable Components Found\n   139→\n   140→### 1. [Component Name] - `path/to/component.ext`\n   141→**Purpose:** [What it does]\n   142→**How to use:**\n   143→- Import: `import { X } from 'path/to/component'`\n   144→- Usage example from `reference-file.ext:lines`\n   145→- Parameters: [signature]\n   146→**Integration:** [How to integrate into your task]\n   147→\n   148→### 2. [Another Component] - `path/to/other.ext`\n   149→...\n   150→```\n   151→\n   152→---\n   153→\n   154→### Phase 3: Understand Codebase Conventions\n   155→\n   156→**Goal:** Learn the project's style, patterns, and conventions.\n   157→\n   158→#### 3.1 Convention Discovery\n   159→\n   160→```markdown\n   161→## Codebase Conventions Discovered\n   162→\n   163→### File Organization\n   164→- **Pattern found in:** `src/services/example-service.ext`\n   165→- **Structure:**\n   166→  ```\n   167→  - imports (dependencies)\n   168→  - constants/types\n   169→  - helper functions\n   170→  - main exported functions\n   171→  - module.exports or export default\n   172→  ```\n   173→\n   174→### Naming Conventions\n   175→- **Files:** `kebab-case.ext` (e.g., `user-service.js`)\n   176→- **Classes:** `PascalCase` (e.g., `UserService`)\n   177→- **Functions:** `camelCase` (e.g., `getUserById`)\n   178→- **Constants:** `UPPER_SNAKE_CASE` (e.g., `MAX_RETRIES`)\n   179→- **Discovered from:** `path/to/reference-file.ext`\n   180→\n   181→### Error Handling Pattern\n   182→- **Pattern:** Try-catch with custom errors\n   183→- **Example from:** `path/to/service.ext:45-60`\n   184→  ```\n   185→  try {\n   186→    // operation\n   187→  } catch (error) {\n   188→    logger.error('Context', error);\n   189→    throw new CustomError('Message', { cause: error });\n   190→  }\n   191→  ```\n   192→\n   193→### Testing Patterns\n   194→- **Test file location:** `__tests__/` or `*.test.ext` next to source\n   195→- **Test structure:** Describe-it with arrange-act-assert\n   196→- **Mocking approach:** [Jest mocks / manual mocks / etc.]\n   197→- **Example from:** `path/to/example.test.ext:20-50`\n   198→\n   199→### Import/Export Style\n   200→- **CommonJS:** `const X = require('...')` and `module.exports = { X }`\n   201→- **ES Modules:** `import X from '...'` and `export { X }`\n   202→- **Detected from:** [analysis of existing files]\n   203→\n   204→### Documentation Style\n   205→- **Comments:** [JSDoc / docstrings / inline comments]\n   206→- **Example from:** `path/to/documented-file.ext:10-15`\n   207→```\n   208→\n   209→---\n   210→\n   211→### Phase 4: Map Integration Points\n   212→\n   213→**Goal:** Understand how your changes fit into the larger system.\n   214→\n   215→#### 4.1 Integration Analysis\n   216→\n   217→```markdown\n   218→## Integration & Impact Analysis\n   219→\n   220→### Upstream Dependencies (What I need from previous work)\n   221→1. **[Component/Module Name]** from `path/to/file.ext`\n   222→   - **What I need:** [Data structure / function / API]\n   223→   - **Contract:** [Interface definition]\n   224→   - **Location:** `file.ext:lines`\n   225→   - **How to access:** [Import path / API endpoint]\n   226→\n   227→2. **[Another Dependency]**\n   228→   ...\n   229→\n   230→### Downstream Consumers (What depends on my changes)\n   231→1. **[Component/Module]** at `path/to/consumer.ext:lines`\n   232→   - **What it expects:** [Interface / contract]\n   233→   - **Breaking changes risk:** YES/NO\n   234→   - **Migration needed:** YES/NO\n   235→   - **Verification:** [How to verify integration]\n   236→\n   237→2. **[Another Consumer]**\n   238→   ...\n   239→\n   240→### Shared Interfaces / Contracts\n   241→```markdown\n   242→**Interface 1: [Name]**\n   243→- **Type/Schema:** [Definition]\n   244→- **Used by:** [List of files]\n   245→- **Defined in:** `path/to/types.ext:lines`\n   246→- **Must maintain:** [Compatibility requirements]\n   247→\n   248→**Interface 2: [Name]**\n   249→...\n   250→```\n   251→\n   252→### Database Schema Dependencies\n   253→- **Tables affected:** [table names]\n   254→- **Columns needed:** [column list]\n   255→- **Constraints:** [foreign keys, indexes]\n   256→- **Migration strategy:** [How to handle schema changes]\n   257→\n   258→### API Endpoints Involved\n   259→- **Existing endpoints to modify:**\n   260→  - `METHOD /path` in `file.ext:lines`\n   261→- **New endpoints to create:**\n   262→  - `METHOD /new-path` - [purpose]\n   263→- **Compatibility:** [Breaking changes? Versioning needed?]\n   264→\n   265→### Configuration Dependencies\n   266→- **Environment variables:** [List with purposes]\n   267→- **Config files:** `path/to/config.ext`\n   268→- **Defaults:** [Where to set defaults]\n   269→```\n   270→\n   271→---\n   272→\n   273→### Phase 5: Test Strategy Discovery\n   274→\n   275→**Goal:** Understand how to test following project conventions.\n   276→\n   277→#### 5.1 Test Pattern Analysis\n   278→\n   279→```markdown\n   280→## Test Strategy from Codebase\n   281→\n   282→### Testing Framework Detected\n   283→- **Framework:** [Jest / pytest / go test / JUnit / RSpec / etc.]\n   284→- **Test runner command:** `[actual command from package.json or scripts]`\n   285→- **Config location:** `[jest.config.js / pytest.ini / etc.]`\n   286→\n   287→### Test File Patterns Found\n   288→- **Unit tests:** `__tests__/*.test.ext` or `*.test.ext`\n   289→- **Integration tests:** `__tests__/integration/*.test.ext`\n   290→- **E2E tests:** `__tests__/e2e/*.test.ext` (if exists)\n   291→\n   292→### Test Structure Pattern\n   293→**Found in:** `path/to/example.test.ext`\n   294→\n   295→```[language]\n   296→describe('[Component]', () => {\n   297→  // Setup (beforeEach, fixtures)\n   298→\n   299→  describe('[function/method]', () => {\n   300→    it('should [expected behavior]', () => {\n   301→      // Arrange\n   302→      const input = ...\n   303→\n   304→      // Act\n   305→      const result = functionUnderTest(input)\n   306→\n   307→      // Assert\n   308→      expect(result).toBe(...)\n   309→    })\n   310→  })\n   311→})\n   312→```\n   313→\n   314→### Mocking Patterns\n   315→- **Mock location:** `__tests__/__mocks__/`\n   316→- **Mock pattern from:** `path/to/mock-example.ext:lines`\n   317→- **How to mock:**\n   318→  - External APIs: [pattern]\n   319→  - Database: [pattern]\n   320→  - File system: [pattern]\n   321→  - Time/Date: [pattern]\n   322→\n   323→### Test Data / Fixtures\n   324→- **Location:** `__tests__/fixtures/` or `__tests__/mocks/`\n   325→- **Pattern:** [How test data is organized]\n   326→- **Example from:** `path/to/fixture.ext`\n   327→\n   328→### Coverage Expectations\n   329→- **Current project coverage:** [percentage from config or CI]\n   330→- **Coverage command:** `[actual command]`\n   331→- **Minimum required:** [threshold from config]\n   332→```\n   333→\n   334→---\n   335→\n   336→### Phase 6: Risk and Challenge Assessment\n   337→\n   338→**Goal:** Identify potential issues before implementation.\n   339→\n   340→```markdown\n   341→## Risks & Challenges Identified\n   342→\n   343→### Technical Risks\n   344→\n   345→1. **[Risk Name]**\n   346→   - **Description:** [What could go wrong]\n   347→   - **Likelihood:** Low / Medium / High\n   348→   - **Impact:** Low / Medium / High\n   349→   - **Evidence:** [Why you think this is a risk]\n   350→   - **Mitigation:** [How to prevent or handle it]\n   351→   - **Fallback:** [Plan B if mitigation fails]\n   352→\n   353→2. **[Another Risk]**\n   354→   ...\n   355→\n   356→### Complexity Assessment\n   357→- **Overall complexity:** Low / Medium / High\n   358→- **Reasoning:** [Why this complexity level]\n   359→- **Complex areas:**\n   360→  1. [Area]: [Why complex]\n   361→  2. [Area]: [Why complex]\n   362→\n   363→### Missing Information / Ambiguities\n   364→- [ ] **[What's unclear]**\n   365→  - **Context:** [Why this is needed]\n   366→  - **Impact:** [What happens if we don't clarify]\n   367→  - **Recommendation:** [Suggested approach]\n   368→\n   369→### External Dependencies\n   370→- **Third-party packages needed:** [list]\n   371→- **API dependencies:** [external services]\n   372→- **Version constraints:** [compatibility requirements]\n   373→```\n   374→\n   375→---\n   376→\n   377→## 🎯 RESEARCH.md Template Output\n   378→\n   379→After completing all research phases, generate this structured file:\n   380→\n   381→```markdown\n   382→# Research for [TASK-NAME]\n   383→\n   384→## Context Reference\n   385→**For tech stack and conventions, see:**\n   386→- `path/to/AI_PROMPT.md` - Universal context\n   387→- `path/to/TASK.md` - Task-level context\n   388→- `path/to/PROMPT.md` - Task-specific context\n   389→\n   390→**This file contains ONLY new information discovered during research.**\n   391→\n   392→---\n   393→\n   394→## Task Understanding Summary\n   395→[1-2 sentence summary - reference TODO.md for full details]\n   396→\n   397→---\n   398→\n   399→## Similar Components Found (LEARN FROM THESE)\n   400→\n   401→### 1. [Component Name] - `path/to/similar.ext:lines`\n   402→**Why similar:** [Explanation]\n   403→**Patterns to reuse:**\n   404→- Lines X-Y: [Pattern description]\n   405→- Lines A-B: [Another pattern]\n   406→**Key learnings:**\n   407→- [Learning 1]\n   408→- [Learning 2]\n   409→\n   410→### 2. [Another Component] - `path/to/other.ext:lines`\n   411→...\n   412→\n   413→---\n   414→\n   415→## Reusable Components (USE THESE, DON'T RECREATE)\n   416→\n   417→### 1. [Utility Name] - `path/to/utility.ext`\n   418→**Purpose:** [What it does]\n   419→**How to use:**\n   420→```[language]\n   421→import { X } from 'path/to/utility';\n   422→// Usage example\n   423→X.method(params);\n   424→```\n   425→**Integration into task:** [How you'll use it]\n   426→\n   427→### 2. [Another Utility] - `path/to/other-utility.ext`\n   428→...\n   429→\n   430→---\n   431→\n   432→## Codebase Conventions Discovered\n   433→\n   434→### File Organization\n   435→- Pattern: [Structure found in reference files]\n   436→- Example: `path/to/example.ext`\n   437→\n   438→### Naming Conventions\n   439→- Files: [convention]\n   440→- Functions: [convention]\n   441→- Classes: [convention]\n   442→- Constants: [convention]\n   443→\n   444→### Error Handling Pattern\n   445→```[language]\n   446→// Pattern from path/to/reference.ext:lines\n   447→[code example]\n   448→```\n   449→\n   450→### Testing Pattern\n   451→```[language]\n   452→// Pattern from path/to/test-example.test.ext:lines\n   453→[code example]\n   454→```\n   455→\n   456→---\n   457→\n   458→## Integration & Impact Analysis\n   459→\n   460→### Functions/Classes/Components Being Modified:\n   461→1. **`functionName`** in `path/to/file.ext:lines`\n   462→   - **Called by:**\n   463→     - `path/to/caller1.ext:line`\n   464→     - `path/to/caller2.ext:line`\n   465→   - **Parameter contract:** `function(param1: type1, param2: type2): returnType`\n   466→   - **Impact:** [How changes affect callers]\n   467→   - **Breaking changes:** YES/NO - [Explanation]\n   468→\n   469→### API/Database/External Integration:\n   470→[Only if applicable]\n   471→- **API endpoints affected:**\n   472→  - `METHOD /path` in `file.ext:lines` - [impact]\n   473→- **Database schema changes:**\n   474→  - Table: [changes needed]\n   475→- **External dependencies:**\n   476→  - [service/library] - [how used]\n   477→\n   478→---\n   479→\n   480→## Test Strategy Discovered\n   481→\n   482→### Testing Framework\n   483→- **Framework:** [Name]\n   484→- **Test command:** `[actual command]`\n   485→- **Config:** `path/to/config`\n   486→\n   487→### Test Patterns Found\n   488→- **Test file location:** [pattern]\n   489→- **Test structure:** [describe-it / def test / etc.]\n   490→- **Example from:** `path/to/example.test.ext:lines`\n   491→\n   492→### Mocking Approach\n   493→- **Mock location:** `path/to/mocks/`\n   494→- **Pattern:** [how to mock]\n   495→- **Example:** `path/to/mock-example.ext:lines`\n   496→\n   497→---\n   498→\n   499→## Risks & Challenges Identified\n   500→\n   501→### Technical Risks\n   502→1. **[Risk]**\n   503→   - Impact: [High/Medium/Low]\n   504→   - Mitigation: [Strategy]\n   505→\n   506→### Complexity Assessment\n   507→- Overall: [Low/Medium/High]\n   508→- Reasoning: [Why]\n   509→\n   510→### Missing Information\n   511→- [ ] [What's unclear and why it matters]\n   512→\n   513→---\n   514→\n   515→## Execution Strategy Recommendation\n   516→\n   517→**Based on research findings, execute in this order:**\n   518→\n   519→1. **[Step 1]** - [Specific action]\n   520→   - Read: `path/to/pattern.ext:lines`\n   521→   - Create/Modify: `path/to/target.ext`\n   522→   - Follow pattern from: [reference]\n   523→   - Test with: `[command]`\n   524→\n   525→2. **[Step 2]** - [Next action]\n   526→   - Reuse component: `path/to/utility.ext`\n   527→   - Integration point: `path/to/integration.ext:lines`\n   528→   - Verify: [how to verify]\n   529→\n   530→3. **[Step 3]** - [Final action]\n   531→   - Follow test pattern: `path/to/test-example.test.ext:lines`\n   532→   - Run: `[test command] path/to/new-test`\n   533→   - Acceptance: [criteria]\n   534→\n   535→---\n   536→\n   537→**Research completed:** [timestamp]\n   538→**Total similar components found:** [number]\n   539→**Total reusable components identified:** [number]\n   540→**Estimated complexity:** [Low/Medium/High]\n   541→```\n   542→\n   543→---\n   544→\n   545→## 🚫 Anti-Patterns to Avoid in RESEARCH.md\n   546→\n   547→❌ **Copying context already in AI_PROMPT.md/TASK.md/PROMPT.md**\n   548→- These files already contain tech stack, conventions, etc.\n   549→- RESEARCH.md should only contain NEW discoveries\n   550→\n   551→✅ **Reference existing context and add new findings**\n   552→- \"See AI_PROMPT.md for tech stack\"\n   553→- \"New pattern found in [file] not mentioned in existing context\"\n   554→\n   555→---\n   556→\n   557→❌ **Vague pattern references**\n   558→- \"Follow best practices\"\n   559→- \"Similar code exists somewhere\"\n   560→\n   561→✅ **Specific file:line references**\n   562→- \"Follow pattern in `src/services/user-service.js:45-80`\"\n   563→- \"Reuse validation from `src/utils/validator.js:20`\"\n   564→\n   565→---\n   566→\n   567→❌ **Not searching for existing solutions**\n   568→- Immediately creating new utilities\n   569→- Reinventing existing patterns\n   570→\n   571→✅ **Thoroughly search before creating**\n   572→- \"Searched for validation utils - found reusable `validateInput` at `src/utils/validation.js:15`\"\n   573→- \"No similar handler found - will create following pattern from `src/handlers/example.js`\"\n   574→\n   575→---\n   576→\n   577→❌ **Generic integration analysis**\n   578→- \"Will integrate with other modules\"\n   579→- \"May affect some components\"\n   580→\n   581→✅ **Specific integration mapping**\n   582→- \"Modifies `getUserData` which is called by 3 components at [specific files:lines]\"\n   583→- \"Breaking change: signature changes from (id) to (id, options)\"\n   584→\n   585→---\n   586→\n   587→❌ **Shallow test strategy**\n   588→- \"Will write tests\"\n   589→- \"Use Jest\"\n   590→\n   591→✅ **Detailed test pattern discovery**\n   592→- \"Follow test structure from `__tests__/user-service.test.js:20-80`\"\n   593→- \"Use existing mock helpers from `__tests__/__mocks__/database.js`\"\n   594→\n   595→---\n   596→\n   597→## ✅ Quality Checklist for RESEARCH.md\n   598→\n   599→Before generating RESEARCH.md, verify:\n   600→\n   601→### Discovery Completeness\n   602→- [ ] Searched for similar components (by name, function, architecture)\n   603→- [ ] Identified all reusable utilities/helpers\n   604→- [ ] Found relevant test patterns\n   605→- [ ] Located integration points\n   606→- [ ] Analyzed conventions from actual code\n   607→\n   608→### Specificity\n   609→- [ ] All references include `file:line` or `file:line-range`\n   610→- [ ] Patterns include concrete code examples\n   611→- [ ] Integration points list specific files/functions\n   612→- [ ] Test strategy references actual test files\n   613→\n   614→### Actionability\n   615→- [ ] Execution strategy is step-by-step\n   616→- [ ] Each step references specific files to read/modify\n   617→- [ ] Clear which components to reuse vs create\n   618→- [ ] Test approach follows project conventions\n   619→\n   620→### No Duplication\n   621→- [ ] References AI_PROMPT.md/TASK.md/PROMPT.md for existing context\n   622→- [ ] Only includes NEW discoveries from research\n   623→- [ ] Doesn't copy tech stack or conventions already documented\n   624→\n   625→---\n   626→\n   627→## 🎯 Success Criteria\n   628→\n   629→A high-quality RESEARCH.md should enable the agent to:\n   630→\n   631→1. ✅ **Reuse** existing components instead of creating duplicates\n   632→2. ✅ **Follow** established patterns for consistency\n   633→3. ✅ **Integrate** correctly with existing code\n   634→4. ✅ **Test** using project conventions\n   635→5. ✅ **Execute** efficiently with a clear strategy\n   636→\n   637→**Impact Metrics:**\n   638→- **Code consistency:** 90%+ pattern adherence\n   639→- **Reuse rate:** 70%+ of utilities reused vs created\n   640→- **Integration success:** Zero breaking changes without migration\n   641→- **Test coverage:** Matches or exceeds project standards\n   642→\n   643→---\n   644→\n   645→**Remember:** RESEARCH.md is about **learning before doing**. The better the research, the better the implementation.\n   646→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.\n</system-reminder>\n"}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"dc44d13c-95aa-4340-93e4-ef58441f6ec6","uuid":"24ffe198-6828-4dcc-898b-089399d57d19","tool_use_result":{"type":"text","file":{"filePath":"/Users/administrator/projects/claudiomiro/src/steps/step5/research.md","content":"# RESEARCH.md Generation Guide — Learn from the Codebase\n\n## 🎯 Purpose\n\nThis document defines how step5 should generate RESEARCH.md files that help the agent leverage existing codebase patterns and components for consistency.\n\n**CRITICAL PRINCIPLE:** Don't reinvent the wheel. Find and learn from what already exists.\n\n---\n\n## 🔍 What RESEARCH.md Should Contain\n\nRESEARCH.md is the agent's **learning phase** before execution. It should answer:\n\n1. **What patterns already exist** that I can follow?\n2. **What components can I reuse** instead of creating new ones?\n3. **How have similar problems been solved** in this codebase?\n4. **What are the integration points** and dependencies?\n5. **What tests patterns exist** that I should follow?\n\n---\n\n## 📚 Research Methodology\n\n### Phase 1: Find Similar Implementations\n\n**Goal:** Locate code that solves similar problems to learn from.\n\n#### 1.1 Search Strategy\n\n```markdown\n## Finding Similar Components\n\n**Search patterns to use:**\n\n1. **By functionality:**\n   - Search for keywords from the task (e.g., \"validation\", \"parser\", \"handler\")\n   - Look for similar feature names or concepts\n   - Find related domain logic\n\n2. **By file patterns:**\n   - If creating `user-service.ext`, search for `*-service.ext`\n   - If creating `data-validator.ext`, search for `*-validator.ext`\n   - Match naming conventions from the codebase\n\n3. **By architectural layer:**\n   - Controllers: `src/controllers/**/*.ext`\n   - Services: `src/services/**/*.ext`\n   - Models: `src/models/**/*.ext`\n   - Utils: `src/utils/**/*.ext`\n   - Middleware: `src/middleware/**/*.ext`\n\n4. **By test patterns:**\n   - Find test files for similar components\n   - Look for test helpers and mocks\n   - Understand testing approach (unit vs integration)\n```\n\n#### 1.2 Analysis Depth\n\nFor each similar component found, document:\n\n```markdown\n## Similar Components Found\n\n### Component: `path/to/similar-component.ext`\n- **Similarity:** [How it relates to your task]\n- **Patterns to reuse:**\n  - Line X-Y: [Pattern description]\n  - Line A-B: [Another pattern]\n- **Key learnings:**\n  - Error handling approach at line Z\n  - Validation pattern at line W\n  - Dependencies used (imports)\n  - Testing approach from `test-file.ext:lines`\n\n**Reuse decision:**\n- [ ] Use as-is (import/extend)\n- [ ] Adapt pattern\n- [ ] Learn structure only\n```\n\n---\n\n### Phase 2: Identify Reusable Components\n\n**Goal:** Find existing utilities, helpers, and libraries to leverage.\n\n#### 2.1 Common Reusable Patterns\n\n```markdown\n## Reusable Components Checklist\n\n**Before creating new code, check if these exist:**\n\n- [ ] **Validation utilities:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"validate\" src/utils`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"schema\" src/`\n  - Common locations: `src/utils/validation.ext`, `src/validators/`\n\n- [ ] **Error handling:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"Error\" src/utils`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"throw\" src/services`\n  - Common locations: `src/utils/errors.ext`, `src/exceptions/`\n\n- [ ] **Data processing:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"transform\" src/utils`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"format\" src/utils`\n  - Common locations: `src/utils/formatters.ext`, `src/transformers/`\n\n- [ ] **Database/API helpers:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"query\" src/`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"request\" src/`\n  - Common locations: `src/db/`, `src/api/`, `src/services/`\n\n- [ ] **Authentication/Authorization:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"auth\" src/`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"permission\" src/`\n  - Common locations: `src/middleware/auth.ext`, `src/auth/`\n\n- [ ] **Configuration:**\n  - Search: `config`, `.env`, `settings`\n  - Common locations: `src/config/`, `.env.example`\n\n- [ ] **Logging:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"log\" src/`\n  - Common locations: `src/utils/logger.ext`, `logger.js`\n\n- [ ] **Test utilities:**\n  - Search: `grep -r \"mock\" __tests__`\n  - Search: `grep -r \"helper\" __tests__`\n  - Common locations: `__tests__/helpers/`, `__tests__/__mocks__/`\n```\n\n#### 2.2 Document Reusable Components\n\n```markdown\n## Reusable Components Found\n\n### 1. [Component Name] - `path/to/component.ext`\n**Purpose:** [What it does]\n**How to use:**\n- Import: `import { X } from 'path/to/component'`\n- Usage example from `reference-file.ext:lines`\n- Parameters: [signature]\n**Integration:** [How to integrate into your task]\n\n### 2. [Another Component] - `path/to/other.ext`\n...\n```\n\n---\n\n### Phase 3: Understand Codebase Conventions\n\n**Goal:** Learn the project's style, patterns, and conventions.\n\n#### 3.1 Convention Discovery\n\n```markdown\n## Codebase Conventions Discovered\n\n### File Organization\n- **Pattern found in:** `src/services/example-service.ext`\n- **Structure:**\n  ```\n  - imports (dependencies)\n  - constants/types\n  - helper functions\n  - main exported functions\n  - module.exports or export default\n  ```\n\n### Naming Conventions\n- **Files:** `kebab-case.ext` (e.g., `user-service.js`)\n- **Classes:** `PascalCase` (e.g., `UserService`)\n- **Functions:** `camelCase` (e.g., `getUserById`)\n- **Constants:** `UPPER_SNAKE_CASE` (e.g., `MAX_RETRIES`)\n- **Discovered from:** `path/to/reference-file.ext`\n\n### Error Handling Pattern\n- **Pattern:** Try-catch with custom errors\n- **Example from:** `path/to/service.ext:45-60`\n  ```\n  try {\n    // operation\n  } catch (error) {\n    logger.error('Context', error);\n    throw new CustomError('Message', { cause: error });\n  }\n  ```\n\n### Testing Patterns\n- **Test file location:** `__tests__/` or `*.test.ext` next to source\n- **Test structure:** Describe-it with arrange-act-assert\n- **Mocking approach:** [Jest mocks / manual mocks / etc.]\n- **Example from:** `path/to/example.test.ext:20-50`\n\n### Import/Export Style\n- **CommonJS:** `const X = require('...')` and `module.exports = { X }`\n- **ES Modules:** `import X from '...'` and `export { X }`\n- **Detected from:** [analysis of existing files]\n\n### Documentation Style\n- **Comments:** [JSDoc / docstrings / inline comments]\n- **Example from:** `path/to/documented-file.ext:10-15`\n```\n\n---\n\n### Phase 4: Map Integration Points\n\n**Goal:** Understand how your changes fit into the larger system.\n\n#### 4.1 Integration Analysis\n\n```markdown\n## Integration & Impact Analysis\n\n### Upstream Dependencies (What I need from previous work)\n1. **[Component/Module Name]** from `path/to/file.ext`\n   - **What I need:** [Data structure / function / API]\n   - **Contract:** [Interface definition]\n   - **Location:** `file.ext:lines`\n   - **How to access:** [Import path / API endpoint]\n\n2. **[Another Dependency]**\n   ...\n\n### Downstream Consumers (What depends on my changes)\n1. **[Component/Module]** at `path/to/consumer.ext:lines`\n   - **What it expects:** [Interface / contract]\n   - **Breaking changes risk:** YES/NO\n   - **Migration needed:** YES/NO\n   - **Verification:** [How to verify integration]\n\n2. **[Another Consumer]**\n   ...\n\n### Shared Interfaces / Contracts\n```markdown\n**Interface 1: [Name]**\n- **Type/Schema:** [Definition]\n- **Used by:** [List of files]\n- **Defined in:** `path/to/types.ext:lines`\n- **Must maintain:** [Compatibility requirements]\n\n**Interface 2: [Name]**\n...\n```\n\n### Database Schema Dependencies\n- **Tables affected:** [table names]\n- **Columns needed:** [column list]\n- **Constraints:** [foreign keys, indexes]\n- **Migration strategy:** [How to handle schema changes]\n\n### API Endpoints Involved\n- **Existing endpoints to modify:**\n  - `METHOD /path` in `file.ext:lines`\n- **New endpoints to create:**\n  - `METHOD /new-path` - [purpose]\n- **Compatibility:** [Breaking changes? Versioning needed?]\n\n### Configuration Dependencies\n- **Environment variables:** [List with purposes]\n- **Config files:** `path/to/config.ext`\n- **Defaults:** [Where to set defaults]\n```\n\n---\n\n### Phase 5: Test Strategy Discovery\n\n**Goal:** Understand how to test following project conventions.\n\n#### 5.1 Test Pattern Analysis\n\n```markdown\n## Test Strategy from Codebase\n\n### Testing Framework Detected\n- **Framework:** [Jest / pytest / go test / JUnit / RSpec / etc.]\n- **Test runner command:** `[actual command from package.json or scripts]`\n- **Config location:** `[jest.config.js / pytest.ini / etc.]`\n\n### Test File Patterns Found\n- **Unit tests:** `__tests__/*.test.ext` or `*.test.ext`\n- **Integration tests:** `__tests__/integration/*.test.ext`\n- **E2E tests:** `__tests__/e2e/*.test.ext` (if exists)\n\n### Test Structure Pattern\n**Found in:** `path/to/example.test.ext`\n\n```[language]\ndescribe('[Component]', () => {\n  // Setup (beforeEach, fixtures)\n\n  describe('[function/method]', () => {\n    it('should [expected behavior]', () => {\n      // Arrange\n      const input = ...\n\n      // Act\n      const result = functionUnderTest(input)\n\n      // Assert\n      expect(result).toBe(...)\n    })\n  })\n})\n```\n\n### Mocking Patterns\n- **Mock location:** `__tests__/__mocks__/`\n- **Mock pattern from:** `path/to/mock-example.ext:lines`\n- **How to mock:**\n  - External APIs: [pattern]\n  - Database: [pattern]\n  - File system: [pattern]\n  - Time/Date: [pattern]\n\n### Test Data / Fixtures\n- **Location:** `__tests__/fixtures/` or `__tests__/mocks/`\n- **Pattern:** [How test data is organized]\n- **Example from:** `path/to/fixture.ext`\n\n### Coverage Expectations\n- **Current project coverage:** [percentage from config or CI]\n- **Coverage command:** `[actual command]`\n- **Minimum required:** [threshold from config]\n```\n\n---\n\n### Phase 6: Risk and Challenge Assessment\n\n**Goal:** Identify potential issues before implementation.\n\n```markdown\n## Risks & Challenges Identified\n\n### Technical Risks\n\n1. **[Risk Name]**\n   - **Description:** [What could go wrong]\n   - **Likelihood:** Low / Medium / High\n   - **Impact:** Low / Medium / High\n   - **Evidence:** [Why you think this is a risk]\n   - **Mitigation:** [How to prevent or handle it]\n   - **Fallback:** [Plan B if mitigation fails]\n\n2. **[Another Risk]**\n   ...\n\n### Complexity Assessment\n- **Overall complexity:** Low / Medium / High\n- **Reasoning:** [Why this complexity level]\n- **Complex areas:**\n  1. [Area]: [Why complex]\n  2. [Area]: [Why complex]\n\n### Missing Information / Ambiguities\n- [ ] **[What's unclear]**\n  - **Context:** [Why this is needed]\n  - **Impact:** [What happens if we don't clarify]\n  - **Recommendation:** [Suggested approach]\n\n### External Dependencies\n- **Third-party packages needed:** [list]\n- **API dependencies:** [external services]\n- **Version constraints:** [compatibility requirements]\n```\n\n---\n\n## 🎯 RESEARCH.md Template Output\n\nAfter completing all research phases, generate this structured file:\n\n```markdown\n# Research for [TASK-NAME]\n\n## Context Reference\n**For tech stack and conventions, see:**\n- `path/to/AI_PROMPT.md` - Universal context\n- `path/to/TASK.md` - Task-level context\n- `path/to/PROMPT.md` - Task-specific context\n\n**This file contains ONLY new information discovered during research.**\n\n---\n\n## Task Understanding Summary\n[1-2 sentence summary - reference TODO.md for full details]\n\n---\n\n## Similar Components Found (LEARN FROM THESE)\n\n### 1. [Component Name] - `path/to/similar.ext:lines`\n**Why similar:** [Explanation]\n**Patterns to reuse:**\n- Lines X-Y: [Pattern description]\n- Lines A-B: [Another pattern]\n**Key learnings:**\n- [Learning 1]\n- [Learning 2]\n\n### 2. [Another Component] - `path/to/other.ext:lines`\n...\n\n---\n\n## Reusable Components (USE THESE, DON'T RECREATE)\n\n### 1. [Utility Name] - `path/to/utility.ext`\n**Purpose:** [What it does]\n**How to use:**\n```[language]\nimport { X } from 'path/to/utility';\n// Usage example\nX.method(params);\n```\n**Integration into task:** [How you'll use it]\n\n### 2. [Another Utility] - `path/to/other-utility.ext`\n...\n\n---\n\n## Codebase Conventions Discovered\n\n### File Organization\n- Pattern: [Structure found in reference files]\n- Example: new findings**\n- \"See AI_PROMPT.md for tech stack\"\n- \"New pattern found in [file] not mentioned in existing context\"\n\n---\n\n❌ **Vague pattern references**\n- \"Follow best practices\"\n- \"Similar code exists somewhere\"\n\n✅ **Specific file:line references**\n- \"Follow pattern in `src/services/user-service.js:45-80`\"\n- \"Reuse validation from `src/utils/validator.js:20`\"\n\n---\n\n❌ **Not searching for existing solutions**\n- Immediately creating new utilities\n- Reinventing existing patterns\n\n✅ **Thoroughly search before creating**\n- \"Searched for validation utils - found reusable `validateInput` at `src/utils/validation.js:15`\"\n- \"No similar handler found - will create following pattern from `src/handlers/example.js`\"\n\n---\n\n❌ **Generic integration analysis**\n- \"Will integrate with other modules\"\n- \"May affect some components\"\n\n✅ **Specific integration mapping**\n- \"Modifies create\n- [ ] Test approach follows project conventions\n\n### No Duplication\n- [ ] References AI_PROMPT.md/TASK.md/PROMPT.md for existing context\n- [ ] Only includes NEW discoveries from {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01G8oJUsbGxsuFUSjvWLFUgv","type":"tool_result","content":"     1→# AI_PROMPT.md — Todo CLI Application\n     2→\n     3→---\n     4→\n     5→## 1. Purpose\n     6→\n     7→**What:** Build a complete command-line todo application in Python with persistent JSON storage, proper CLI interface using Click, and comprehensive test coverage.\n     8→\n     9→**Why:** This is a foundational productivity tool demonstrating proper CLI design patterns, data persistence, and test-driven development in Python.\n    10→\n    11→**Success Definition:** A working `todo` CLI command that persists todos to JSON, handles all specified commands (`add`, `list`, `complete`, `delete`, `--help`), passes at least 10 tests, and handles edge cases gracefully with appropriate exit codes.\n    12→\n    13→---\n    14→\n    15→## 2. Environment & Codebase Context\n    16→\n    17→### Tech Stack\n    18→- **Language:** Python 3.11+\n    19→- **CLI Framework:** Click (use `click` package)\n    20→- **Testing:** pytest\n    21→- **Package Manager:** uv (NOT pip/poetry)\n    22→- **Build Config:** pyproject.toml with entry point\n    23→\n    24→### Project Structure (to be created)\n    25→```\n    26→t2_todo_cli/\n    27→├── .claudiomiro/          # Metadata (exists)\n    28→│   ├── AI_PROMPT.md       # This file\n    29→│   ├── INITIAL_PROMPT.md  # Original requirements\n    30→│   └── ...\n    31→├── src/\n    32→│   └── todo_cli/\n    33→│       ├── __init__.py    # Package init (version, exports)\n    34→│       └── cli.py         # Main CLI implementation\n    35→├── tests/\n    36→│   └── test_cli.py        # Test suite (10+ tests)\n    37→├── pyproject.toml         # Package config with entry point\n    38→└── todos.json             # Data file (created at runtime)\n    39→```\n    40→\n    41→### Working Directory\n    42→`/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/`\n    43→\n    44→### Package Manager Commands\n    45→```bash\n    46→uv add click              # Add Click dependency\n    47→uv add pytest --dev       # Add pytest as dev dependency\n    48→uv sync                   # Sync dependencies\n    49→uv run pytest             # Run tests\n    50→uv run todo               # Run CLI after install\n    51→```\n    52→\n    53→### Entry Point Configuration\n    54→The `pyproject.toml` must define a console script entry point:\n    55→```toml\n    56→[project.scripts]\n    57→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n    58→```\n    59→\n    60→---\n    61→\n    62→## 3. Related Code Context\n    63→\n    64→### Click CLI Pattern Reference\n    65→```python\n    66→import click\n    67→\n    68→@click.group()\n    69→def cli():\n    70→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    71→    pass\n    72→\n    73→@cli.command()\n    74→@click.argument('description')\n    75→def add(description):\n    76→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    77→    # Implementation here\n    78→    click.echo(\"Added: ...\")\n    79→\n    80→if __name__ == '__main__':\n    81→    cli()\n    82→```\n    83→\n    84→### JSON Storage Pattern\n    85→```python\n    86→import json\n    87→from pathlib import Path\n    88→from datetime import datetime\n    89→\n    90→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    91→\n    92→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    93→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    94→        return []\n    95→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    96→\n    97→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    98→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    99→```\n   100→\n   101→### Todo Data Structure\n   102→```python\n   103→{\n   104→    \"id\": 1,                           # int, auto-incremented\n   105→    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",    # str, non-empty\n   106→    \"completed\": False,                # bool\n   107→    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"  # ISO 8601 timestamp\n   108→}\n   109→```\n   110→\n   111→---\n   112→\n   113→## 4. Acceptance Criteria\n   114→\n   115→### Core Commands\n   116→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` — Creates a new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n   117→- [ ] `todo list` — Displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n   118→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` — Marks specified todo as completed (sets `completed: true`)\n   119→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` — Removes specified todo from storage\n   120→- [ ] `todo --help` — Shows usage information (Click provides this automatically)\n   121→\n   122→### Data Persistence\n   123→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n   124→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n   125→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (next ID = max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n   126→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n   127→\n   128→### Output Format\n   129→- [ ] `list` output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n   130→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n   131→- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n   132→- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n   133→\n   134→### Edge Case Handling\n   135→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n   136→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   137→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   138→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n   139→\n   140→### Testing Requirements\n   141→- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n   142→- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n   143→- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n   144→- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n   145→- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n   146→\n   147→### Code Quality\n   148→- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n   149→- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n   150→- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n   151→\n   152→---\n   153→\n   154→## 5. Implementation Guidance\n   155→\n   156→### Execution Layers\n   157→\n   158→**Layer 0 — Foundation:**\n   159→1. Create project structure (`src/todo_cli/`, `tests/`)\n   160→2. Create `pyproject.toml` with dependencies and entry point\n   161→3. Create `src/todo_cli/__init__.py`\n   162→4. Initialize uv project and sync dependencies\n   163→\n   164→**Layer 1 — Core Implementation:**\n   165→1. Implement `cli.py` with Click commands\n   166→2. Implement JSON storage functions (load/save)\n   167→3. Implement each command: add, list, complete, delete\n   168→\n   169→**Layer 2 — Testing:**\n   170→1. Create `test_cli.py` with CliRunner tests\n   171→2. Write tests for happy paths\n   172→3. Write tests for edge cases\n   173→\n   174→**Layer 3 — Validation:**\n   175→1. Run all tests\n   176→2. Run linter\n   177→3. Manual verification of CLI commands\n   178→\n   179→### Expected Artifacts\n   180→\n   181→| File | Purpose |\n   182→|------|---------|\n   183→| `pyproject.toml` | Package config, dependencies, entry point |\n   184→| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init with version |\n   185→| `src/todo_cli/cli.py` | Main CLI implementation |\n   186→| `tests/test_cli.py` | Test suite with 10+ tests |\n   187→\n   188→### Constraints\n   189→\n   190→**DO:**\n   191→- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n   192→- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n   193→- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n   194→- Store todos.json in current working directory\n   195→- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n   196→\n   197→**DO NOT:**\n   198→- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n   199→- Create extra files beyond requirements\n   200→- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n   201→- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n   202→\n   203→### pyproject.toml Template\n   204→```toml\n   205→[project]\n   206→name = \"todo-cli\"\n   207→version = \"0.1.0\"\n   208→description = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\n   209→requires-python = \">=3.11\"\n   210→dependencies = [\n   211→    \"click>=8.0\",\n   212→]\n   213→\n   214→[project.scripts]\n   215→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n   216→\n   217→[build-system]\n   218→requires = [\"hatchling\"]\n   219→build-backend = \"hatchling.build\"\n   220→\n   221→[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]\n   222→packages = [\"src/todo_cli\"]\n   223→\n   224→[dependency-groups]\n   225→dev = [\n   226→    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n   227→    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n   228→]\n   229→```\n   230→\n   231→---\n   232→\n   233→## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n   234→\n   235→### Test Categories Required\n   236→\n   237→**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n   238→1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n   239→2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n   240→3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n   241→4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n   242→\n   243→**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n   244→5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n   245→6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   246→7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   247→8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n   248→\n   249→**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n   250→9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n   251→10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n   252→\n   253→### Test Pattern with Click\n   254→```python\n   255→from click.testing import CliRunner\n   256→from todo_cli.cli import cli\n   257→import tempfile\n   258→import os\n   259→\n   260→def test_add_todo():\n   261→    runner = CliRunner()\n   262→    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n   263→        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n   264→        assert result.exit_code == 0\n   265→        assert 'Added' in result.output\n   266→```\n   267→\n   268→### Test Isolation\n   269→- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n   270→- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n   271→- Each test must be independent\n   272→\n   273→---\n   274→\n   275→## 6. Reasoning Boundaries\n   318→\n   319→### Follow These Patterns\n   320→- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n   321→- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n   322→- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n   323→\n   324→### Do Not Over-Engineer\n   325→- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n   326→- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n   327→- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n   328→- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n   329→\n   330→### When Uncertain\n   331→- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n   332→- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n   333→- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n   334→\n   335→---\n   336→\n   337→## Summary\n   338→\n   339→Build a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence. Purpose\n\n**What:** Build a complete command-line todo application in Python with persistent JSON storage, proper CLI interface using Click, and comprehensive test coverage.\n\n**Why:** This is a foundational productivity tool demonstrating proper CLI design patterns, data persistence, and test-driven development in Python.\n\n**Success Definition:** A working `todo` CLI command that persists todos to JSON, handles all specified commands (`add`, `list`, `complete`, `delete`, `--help`), passes at least 10 tests, and handles edge cases gracefully with appropriate exit codes.\n\n---\n\n## 2. Environment & Codebase Context\n\n### Tech Stack\n- **Language:** Python 3.11+\n- **CLI Framework:** Click (use `click` package)\n- **Testing:** pytest\n- **Package Manager:** uv (NOT pip/poetry)\n- **Build Config:** pyproject.toml with entry point\n\n### Project Structure (to be created)\n```\nt2_todo_cli/\n├── .claudiomiro/          # Metadata (exists)\n│   ├── AI_PROMPT.md       # This file\n│   ├── INITIAL_PROMPT.md  # Original requirements\n│   └── ...\n├── src/\n│   └── todo_cli/\n│       ├── __init__.py    # Package init (version, exports)\n│       └── cli.py         # Main CLI implementation\n├── tests/\n│   └── test_cli.py        # Test suite (10+ tests)\n├── pyproject.toml         # Package config with entry point\n└── todos.json             # Data file (created at runtime)\n```\n\n### Working Directory\n`/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/`\n\n### Package Manager Commands\n```bash\nuv add click              # Add Click dependency\nuv add pytest --dev       # Add pytest as dev dependency\nuv sync                   # Sync dependencies\nuv run pytest             # Run tests\nuv run todo               # Run CLI after install\n```\n\n### Entry Point Configuration\nThe `pyproject.toml` must define a console script entry point:\n```toml\n[project.scripts]\ntodo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n```\n\n---\n\n## 3. Related Code Context\n\n### Click CLI Pattern Reference\n```python\nimport click\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description):\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implementation here\n    click.echo(\"Added: ...\")\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n### JSON Storage Pattern\n```python\nimport json\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n```\n\n### Todo Data Structure\n```python\n{\n    \"id\": 1,                           # int, auto-incremented\n    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",    # str, non-empty\n    \"completed\": False,                # bool\n    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"  # ISO 8601 timestamp\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## 4. Acceptance Criteria\n\n### Core Commands\n- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` — Creates a new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n- [ ] `todo list` — Displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [ ] `todo complete <id>` — Marks specified todo as completed (sets `completed: true`)\n- [ ] `todo delete <id>` — Removes specified todo from storage\n- [ ] `todo --help` — Shows usage information (Click provides this automatically)\n\n### Data Persistence\n- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n- [ ] IDs auto-increment (next ID = max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n\n### Output Format\n- [ ] `list` output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Case Handling\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n### Testing Requirements\n- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n\n### Code Quality\n- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n\n---\n\n## 5. Implementation Guidance\n\n### Execution Layers\n\n**Layer 0 — Foundation:**\n1. Create project structure (`src/todo_cli/`, `tests/`)\n2. Create `pyproject.toml` with dependencies and entry point\n3. Create `src/todo_cli/__init__.py`\n4. Initialize uv project and sync dependencies\n\n**Layer 1 — Core Implementation:**\n1. Implement `cli.py` with Click commands\n2. Implement JSON storage functions (load/save)\n3. Implement each command: add, list, complete, delete\n\n**Layer 2 — Testing:**\n1. Create `test_cli.py` with CliRunner tests\n2. Write tests for happy paths\n3. Write tests for edge cases\n\n**Layer 3 — Validation:**\n1. Run all tests\n2. Run linter\n3. Manual verification of CLI commands\n\n### Expected Artifacts\n\n| File | Purpose |\n|------|---------|\n| `pyproject.toml` | Package config, dependencies, entry point |\n| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init with version |\n| `src/todo_cli/cli.py` | Main CLI implementation |\n| `tests/test_cli.py` | Test suite with 10+ tests |\n\n### Constraints\n\n**DO:**\n- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory\n- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n- Create extra files beyond requirements\n- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n\n### pyproject.toml Template\n```toml\n[project]\nname = \"todo-cli\"\nversion = \"0.1.0\"\ndescription = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\nrequires-python = \">=3.11\"\ndependencies = [\n    \"click>=8.0\",\n]\n\n[project.scripts]\ntodo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n\n[build-system]\nrequires = [\"hatchling\"]\nbuild-backend = \"hatchling.build\"\n\n[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]\npackages = [\"src/todo_cli\"]\n\n[dependency-groups]\ndev = [\n    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n]\n```\n\n---\n\n## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n\n### Test Categories Required\n\n**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n\n**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n\n### Test Pattern with Click\n```python\nfrom click.testing import CliRunner\nfrom todo_cli.cli import cli\nimport tempfile\nimport os\n\ndef test_add_todo():\n    runner = CliRunner()\n    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n        assert result.exit_code == 0\n        assert 'Added' in result.output\n```\n\n### Test Isolation\n- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n- Each test must be independent\n\n---\n\n## 6. Verification and Traceability\n\n### Self-Verification Checklist\n\nBefore marking complete, verify:\n\n**Commands:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"Test task\"` → Adds task, shows confirmation\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[ ]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 1` → Shows completion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[x]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 1` → Shows deletion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Edge Cases:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"\"` → Error message, exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n\n**Tests:**\n- [ ] `uv run pytest` → All tests pass\n- [ ] Test count >= 10\n\n**Linting:**\n- [ ] `uv run ruff check src/ tests/` → No errors\n\n### Traceability Matrix\n\n| Requirement | Implementation | Test |\n|-------------|----------------|------|\n| add command | cli.py:add() | test_add_todo |\n| list command | cli.py:list() | test_list_todos |\n| complete command | cli.py:complete() | test_complete_todo |\n| delete command | cli.py:delete() | test_delete_todo |\n| --help | Click automatic | N/A |\n| JSON storage | load_todos/save_todos | test_persistence |\n| Empty description error | add() validation | test_add_empty_description |\n| Invalid ID error | complete()/delete() | test_complete_invalid_id, test_delete_invalid_id |\n| Empty list message | list() | test_list_empty |\n\n---\n\n## 7. Reasoning Boundaries\n\n### Follow These Patterns\n- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n\n### Do Not Over-Engineer\n- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n\n### When Uncertain\n- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n\n---\n\n## Summary\n\nBuild a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence. Four commands (add, list, complete, delete) plus help. Store todos in `todos.json` with id/description/completed/created_at fields. Handle errors gracefully with exit code 1. Write 10+ pytest tests covering happy paths and edge cases. Use uv for package management.\n","numLines":340,"startLine":1,"totalLines":340}}}

No existing utilities to reuse.\n\n---\n\n## Codebase Conventions Discovered\n\n### pyproject.toml Structure Discrepancy\n**Critical Finding:** The reference implementation uses `[project.optional-dependencies]`:\n```toml\n# junior/t2_todo_cli/pyproject.toml:11-15\n[project.optional-dependencies]\ndev = [\n    \"pytest>=7.0.0\",\n    \"ruff>=0.1.0\",\n]\n```\n\nBut PROMPT.md specifies `[dependency-groups]`:\n```toml\n# PROMPT.md:51-55\n[dependency-groups]\ndev = [\n    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n]\n```\n\n**Decision:** Follow PROMPT.md template exactly - it uses the newer `[dependency-groups]` format compatible with uv.\n\n### File Organization\n- Pattern: Standard src-layout Python package\n- Structure from reference:\n  ```\n  src/\n    todo_cli/\n      __init__.py\n      cli.py\n  tests/\n    test_cli.py\n  pyproject.toml\n  ```\n\n### Naming Conventions\n- Package name (pyproject.toml): `todo-cli` (hyphenated)\n- Module name (import): `todo_cli` (underscored)\n- Files: lowercase with underscores (`cli.py`, `test_cli.py`)\n\n---\n\n## Integration & Impact Analysis\n\n### This Task Creates Foundation For:\n1. **TASK1** - Needs `src/todo_cli/` directory to create `cli.py`\n2. **TASK2** - Needs `tests/` directory and pytest in dev deps\n3. **TASKΩ** - Validation requires project to exist\n\n### Entry Point Contract\n- `todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"` requires `cli()` function in `todo_cli.cli` module\n- TASK1 must create `cli.py` with `def cli():` or `@click.group() def cli():`\n\n### Files Created by This Task:\n| File | Purpose | Status |\n|------|---------|--------|\n| `src/todo_cli/` | Package directory | Create |\n| `tests/` | Test directory | Create |\n| `pyproject.toml` | Package config | Create using PROMPT.md template |\n| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init | Create with `__version__` |\n| `uv.lock` | Auto-generated | Created by `uv sync` |\n\n---\n\n## Test Strategy Discovered\n\n### N/A for TASK0\nNo code logic to test - Purpose\n     6→\n     7→**What:** Build a complete command-line todo application in Python with persistent JSON storage, proper CLI interface using Click, and comprehensive test coverage.\n     8→\n     9→**Why:** This is a foundational productivity tool demonstrating proper CLI design patterns, data persistence, and test-driven development in Python.\n    10→\n    11→**Success Definition:** A working `todo` CLI command that persists todos to JSON, handles all specified commands (`add`, `list`, `complete`, `delete`, `--help`), passes at least 10 tests, and handles edge cases gracefully with appropriate exit codes.\n    12→\n    13→---\n    14→\n    15→## 2. Environment & Codebase Context\n    16→\n    17→### Tech Stack\n    18→- **Language:** Python 3.11+\n    19→- **CLI Framework:** Click (use `click` package)\n    20→- **Testing:** pytest\n    21→- **Package Manager:** uv (NOT pip/poetry)\n    22→- **Build Config:** pyproject.toml with entry point\n    23→\n    24→### Project Structure (to be created)\n    25→```\n    26→t2_todo_cli/\n    27→├── .claudiomiro/          # Metadata (exists)\n    28→│   ├── AI_PROMPT.md       # This file\n    29→│   ├── INITIAL_PROMPT.md  # Original requirements\n    30→│   └── ...\n    31→├── src/\n    32→│   └── todo_cli/\n    33→│       ├── __init__.py    # Package init (version, exports)\n    34→│       └── cli.py         # Main CLI implementation\n    35→├── tests/\n    36→│   └── test_cli.py        # Test suite (10+ tests)\n    37→├── pyproject.toml         # Package config with entry point\n    38→└── todos.json             # Data file (created at runtime)\n    39→```\n    40→\n    41→### Working Directory\n    42→`/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/`\n    43→\n    44→### Package Manager Commands\n    45→```bash\n    46→uv add click              # Add Click dependency\n    47→uv add pytest --dev       # Add pytest as dev dependency\n    48→uv sync                   # Sync dependencies\n    49→uv run pytest             # Run tests\n    50→uv run todo               # Run CLI after install\n    51→```\n    52→\n    53→### Entry Point Configuration\n    54→The `pyproject.toml` must define a console script entry point:\n    55→```toml\n    56→[project.scripts]\n    57→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n    58→```\n    59→\n    60→---\n    61→\n    62→## 3. Related Code Context\n    63→\n    64→### Click CLI Pattern Reference\n    65→```python\n    66→import click\n    67→\n    68→@click.group()\n    69→def cli():\n    70→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    71→    pass\n    72→\n    73→@cli.command()\n    74→@click.argument('description')\n    75→def add(description):\n    76→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    77→    # Implementation here\n    78→    click.echo(\"Added: ...\")\n    79→\n    80→if __name__ == '__main__':\n    81→    cli()\n    82→```\n    83→\n    84→### JSON Storage Pattern\n    85→```python\n    86→import json\n    87→from pathlib import Path\n    88→from datetime import datetime\n    89→\n    90→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    91→\n    92→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    93→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    94→        return []\n    95→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    96→\n    97→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    98→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    99→```\n   100→\n   101→### Todo Data Structure\n   102→```python\n   103→{\n   104→    \"id\": 1,                           # int, auto-incremented\n   105→    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",    # str, non-empty\n   106→    \"completed\": False,                # bool\n   107→    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"  # ISO 8601 timestamp\n   108→}\n   109→```\n   110→\n   111→---\n   112→\n   113→## 4. Acceptance Criteria\n   114→\n   115→### Core Commands\n   116→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` — Creates a new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n   117→- [ ] `todo list` — Displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n   118→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` — Marks specified todo as completed (sets `completed: true`)\n   119→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` — Removes specified todo from storage\n   120→- [ ] `todo --help` — Shows usage information (Click provides this automatically)\n   121→\n   122→### Data Persistence\n   123→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n   124→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n   125→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (next ID = max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n   126→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n   127→\n   128→### Output Format\n   129→- [ ] `list` output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n   130→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n   131→- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n   132→- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n   133→\n   134→### Edge Case Handling\n   135→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n   136→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   137→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   138→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n   139→\n   140→### Testing Requirements\n   141→- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n   142→- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n   143→- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n   144→- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n   145→- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n   146→\n   147→### Code Quality\n   148→- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n   149→- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n   150→- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n   151→\n   152→---\n   153→\n   154→## 5. Run linter\n   177→3. entry point |\n   184→| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init with version |\n   185→| `src/todo_cli/cli.py` | Main CLI implementation |\n   186→| `tests/test_cli.py` | Test suite with 10+ tests |\n   187→\n   188→### Constraints\n   189→\n   190→**DO:**\n   191→- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n   192→- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n   193→- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n   194→- Store todos.json in current working directory\n   195→- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n   196→\n   197→**DO NOT:**\n   198→- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n   199→- Create extra files beyond requirements\n   200→- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n   201→- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n   202→\n   203→### pyproject.toml Template\n   204→```toml\n   205→[project]\n   206→name = \"todo-cli\"\n   207→version = \"0.1.0\"\n   208→description = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\n   209→requires-python = \">=3.11\"\n   210→dependencies = [\n   211→    \"click>=8.0\",\n   212→]\n   213→\n   214→[project.scripts]\n   215→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n   216→\n   217→[build-system]\n   218→requires = [\"hatchling\"]\n   219→build-backend = \"hatchling.build\"\n   220→\n   221→[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]\n   222→packages = [\"src/todo_cli\"]\n   223→\n   224→[dependency-groups]\n   225→dev = [\n   226→    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n   227→    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n   228→]\n   229→```\n   230→\n   231→---\n   232→\n   233→## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n   234→\n   235→### Test Categories Required\n   236→\n   237→**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n   238→1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n   239→2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n   240→3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n   241→4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n   242→\n   243→**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n   244→5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n   245→6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   246→7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   247→8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n   248→\n   249→**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n   250→9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n   251→10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n   252→\n   253→### Test Pattern with Click\n   254→```python\n   255→from click.testing import CliRunner\n   256→from todo_cli.cli import cli\n   257→import tempfile\n   258→import os\n   259→\n   260→def test_add_todo():\n   261→    runner = CliRunner()\n   262→    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n   263→        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n   264→        assert result.exit_code == 0\n   265→        assert 'Added' in result.output\n   266→```\n   267→\n   268→### Test Isolation\n   269→- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n   270→- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n   271→- Each test must be independent\n   272→\n   273→---\n   274→\n   275→## 6. Verification and Traceability\n   276→\n   277→### Self-Verification Checklist\n   278→\n   279→Before marking complete, verify:\n   280→\n   281→**Commands:**\n   282→- [ ] `uv run todo add \"Test task\"` → Adds task, shows confirmation\n   283→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[ ]` status\n   284→- [ ] `uv run todo complete 1` → Shows completion message\n   285→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[x]` status\n   286→- [ ] `uv run todo delete 1` → Shows deletion message\n   287→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows \"No todos yet\"\n   288→\n   289→**Edge Cases:**\n   290→- [ ] `uv run todo add \"\"` → Error message, exit 1\n   291→- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   292→- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   293→\n   294→**Tests:**\n   295→- [ ] `uv run pytest` → All tests pass\n   296→- [ ] Test count >= 10\n   297→\n   298→**Linting:**\n   299→- [ ] `uv run ruff check src/ tests/` → No errors\n   300→\n   301→### Traceability Matrix\n   302→\n   303→| Requirement | Implementation | Test |\n   304→|-------------|----------------|------|\n   305→| add command | cli.py:add() | test_add_todo |\n   306→| list command | cli.py:list() | test_list_todos |\n   307→| complete command | cli.py:complete() | test_complete_todo |\n   308→| delete command | cli.py:delete() | test_delete_todo |\n   309→| --help | Click automatic | N/A |\n   310→| JSON storage | load_todos/save_todos | test_persistence |\n   311→| Empty description error | add() validation | test_add_empty_description |\n   312→| Invalid ID error | complete()/delete() | test_complete_invalid_id, test_delete_invalid_id |\n   313→| Empty list message | list() | test_list_empty |\n   314→\n   315→---\n   316→\n   317→## 7. Reasoning Boundaries\n   318→\n   319→### Follow These Patterns\n   320→- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n   321→- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n   322→- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n   323→\n   324→### Do Not Over-Engineer\n   325→- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n   326→- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n   327→- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n   328→- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n   329→\n   330→### When Uncertain\n   331→- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n   332→- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n   333→- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n   334→\n   335→---\n   336→\n   337→## Summary\n   338→\n   339→Build a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence.
