[\"--help\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"Usage:\" in result.output\n    assert \"add\" in result.output\n    assert \"list\" in result.output\n    assert \"complete\" in result.output\n    assert \"delete\" in result.output\n\n\ndef test_add_creates_todo(isolated_runner, tmp_path):\n    \"\"\"Test that add command creates a todo and saves it to JSON.\"\"\"\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Buy groceries\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"Added todo #1\" in result.output\n    assert \"Buy groceries\" in result.output\n\n    # Verify JSON file was created\n    todos_file = tmp_path / \"todos.json\"\n    assert todos_file.exists()\n\n    todos = json.loads(todos_file.read_text())\n    assert len(todos) == 1\n    assert todos[0][\"id\"] == 1\n    assert todos[0][\"description\"] == \"Buy groceries\"\n    assert todos[0][\"completed\"] is False\n    assert \"created_at\" in todos[0]\n\n\ndef test_add_empty_description_shows_error(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that add with empty description shows error.\"\"\"\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 1\n    assert \"empty\" in result.output.lower()\n\n\ndef test_add_whitespace_only_description_shows_error(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that add with whitespace-only description shows error.\"\"\"\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"   \"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 1\n    assert \"empty\" in result.output.lower()\n\n\ndef test_add_auto_increments_id(isolated_runner, tmp_path):\n    \"\"\"Test that IDs auto-increment for multiple todos.\"\"\"\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"First task\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Second task\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Third task\"])\n\n    todos_file = tmp_path / \"todos.json\"\n    todos = json.loads(todos_file.read_text())\n\n    assert len(todos) == 3\n    assert todos[0][\"id\"] == 1\n    assert todos[1][\"id\"] == 2\n    assert todos[2][\"id\"] == 3\n\n\ndef test_list_shows_todos(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that list command shows all todos.\"\"\"\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Task one\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Task two\"])\n\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"list\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"Task one\" in result.output\n    assert \"Task two\" in result.output\n\n\ndef test_list_empty_shows_message(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that list shows message when no todos exist.\"\"\"\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"list\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"No todos yet\" in result.output\n\n\ndef test_list_shows_correct_status_markers(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that list shows [x] for completed and [ ] for pending.\"\"\"\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Pending task\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Completed task\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"complete\", \"2\"])\n\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"list\"])\n    assert \"[ ]\" in result.output  # Pending task marker\n    assert \"[x]\" in result.output  # Completed task marker\n\n\ndef test_complete_marks_todo_done(isolated_runner, tmp_path):\n    \"\"\"Test that complete command marks todo as done.\"\"\"\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Task to complete\"])\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"complete\", \"1\"])\n\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"Completed\" in result.output\n\n    todos_file = tmp_path / \"todos.json\"\n    todos = json.loads(todos_file.read_text())\n    assert todos[0][\"completed\"] is True\n\n\ndef test_complete_invalid_id_shows_error(isolated_runner):\n    \"\"\"Test that complete with invalid ID shows error.\"\"\"\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"complete\", \"999\"])\n    assert result.exit_code == 1\n    assert \"not found\" in result.output.lower()\n\n\ndef test_delete_removes_todo(isolated_runner, tmp_path):\n    \"\"\"Test that delete command removes todo from JSON.\"\"\"\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Task to delete\"])\n    result = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"delete\", \"1\"])\n\n    assert result.exit_code == 0\n    assert \"Deleted\" in result.output\n\n    todos_file = tmp_path / \"todos.json\"\n    todos = = isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"list\"])\n    assert \"Persistent task\" in result.output\n\n    # Third run: complete todo\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"complete\", \"1\"])\n\n    # Fourth isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"delete\", \"1\"])\n    isolated_runner.invoke(cli, [\"add\", \"Task 3\"])\n\n    todos_file = tmp_path / \"todos.json\"\n    todos = json.loads(todos_file.read_text())\n\n    # Should have IDs 2 and 3, not 1 and 2\n    ids = [todo[\"id\"] for todo in todos]\n    assert 1 not in ids\n    assert 2 in ids\n    assert 3 in ids\n\n\ndef [ ] {description}`\n- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n\n**`complete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n\n**`delete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Remove todo from list","numLines":30,"startLine":30,"totalLines":141}}}

Must export `cli` as Click group at module level\n   126→\n   127→### This Module is Imported By:\n   128→1. **TASK2 tests:** `from todo_cli.cli import cli`\n   129→   - Tests invoke: `runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Test'])`\n   130→\n   131→### Data File Contract:\n   132→- Creates/reads `todos.json` in current working directory\n   133→- Schema per AI_PROMPT.md:101-109:\n   134→  ```json\n   135→  {\n   136→    \"id\": 1,\n   137→    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n   138→    \"completed\": false,\n   139→    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n   140→  }\n   141→  ```\n   142→\n   143→### Exit Code Contract:\n   144→| Result | Exit Code |\n   145→|--------|-----------|\n   146→| Success | 0 |\n   147→| Error (empty desc, invalid ID) | 1 |\n   148→\n   149→---\n   150→\n   151→## Test Strategy Discovered\n   152→\n   153→### Testing Framework\n   154→- **Framework:** pytest\n   155→- **CLI Testing:** `click.testing.CliRunner`\n   156→- **Test file:** Will be `tests/test_cli.py` (TASK2)\n   157→\n   158→### Test Patterns from Reference - `junior/t2_todo_cli/tests/test_cli.py`\n   159→- **Fixture pattern (lines 11-21):**\n   160→  ```python\n   161→  @pytest.fixture\n   162→  def runner():\n   163→      return CliRunner()\n   164→\n   165→  @pytest.fixture\n   166→  def isolated_runner(runner, tmp_path, monkeypatch):\n   167→      monkeypatch.chdir(tmp_path)\n   168→      return runner\n   169→  ```\n   170→- **Invocation pattern:** `result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Task'])`\n   171→- **Assertions:** Check `result.exit_code` and `result.output`\n   172→\n   173→### Key Test Assertions to Support:\n   174→- `\"Added\" in result.output` (not exact match)\n   175→- `\"not found\" in result.output.lower()`\n   176→- `\"No todos yet\" in result.output`\n   177→- `result.exit_code == 0` or `result.exit_code == 1`\n   178→\n   179→---\n   180→\n   181→## Risks & Challenges Identified\n   182→\n   183→### Technical Risks\n   184→\n   185→1. **Output Format Mismatch**\n   186→   - Impact: High (tests may fail)\n   187→   - Issue: Reference uses `\"Added todo #{id}: ...\"`, specs say `\"Added todo: ...\"`\n   188→   - Mitigation: Follow PROMPT.md specs exactly\n   189→   - Tests use substring matching, so both formats may pass\n   190→\n   191→2. **Empty String vs Whitespace-Only**\n   192→   - Impact: Medium\n   193→   - Reference trims description and checks empty (line 89-92)\n   194→   - PROMPT.md says \"empty description\" error\n   195→   - Mitigation: `description.strip()` then check empty\n   196→\n   197→3. **JSON File Read Error**\n   198→   - Impact: Low\n   199→   - Reference handles JSONDecodeError (line 32-33)\n   200→   - PROMPT.md code template doesn't include this\n   201→   - Decision: Keep simple per spec, don't add error handling not requested\n   202→\n   203→### Complexity Assessment\n   204→- Overall: **Low-Medium**\n   205→- Reasoning: Clear specs and code template provided in PROMPT.md:63-111\n   206→  - [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n    49→- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n    50→\n    51→**`complete <id>`**\n    52→- Argument: id (integer)\n    53→- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n    54→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    55→- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    56→\n    57→**`delete <id>`**\n    58→- Argument: id (integer)\n    59→- Remove todo from list\n    60→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    61→- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    62→\n    63→### Code Template\n    64→```python\n    65→import click\n    66→import json\n    67→import sys\n    68→from pathlib import Path\n    69→from datetime import datetime\n    70→\n    71→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    72→\n    73→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    74→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    75→        return []\n    76→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    77→\n    78→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    79→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    80→\n    81→@click.group()\n    82→def cli():\n    83→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    84→    pass\n    85→\n    86→@cli.command()\n    87→@click.argument('description')\n    88→def add(description: str) -> None:\n    89→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    90→    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n    91→\n    92→@cli.command('list')\n    93→def list_todos() -> None:\n    94→    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    95→    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n    96→\n    97→@cli.command()\n    98→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n    99→def complete(id: int) -> None:\n   100→    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n   101→    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n   102→\n   103→@cli.command()\n   104→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n   105→def delete(id: int) -> None:\n   106→    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n   107→    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n   108→\n   109→if __name__ == '__main__':\n   110→    cli()\n   111→```\n   112→\n   113→## LAYER\n   114→1\n   115→\n   116→## PARALLELIZATION\n   117→Parallel with: None\n   118→\n   119→## CONSTRAINTS\n   120→- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n   121→- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n   122→- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n   123→- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n   124→- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n   125→- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n   126→- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n   127→- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n   128→\n   129→## VALIDATION\n   130→After completion, verify manually:\n   131→```bash\n   132→uv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\n   133→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [ ] Test task\"\n   134→uv run todo complete 1                # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n   135→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n\n## COMPLEXITY\nMedium\n\n## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n**For complete environment context, read:**\n- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n\n## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n\n### Files This Task Will Create\n- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n\n### Patterns to Follow\n- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n  ```python\n  {\n      \"id\": 1,\n      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n      \"completed\": False,\n      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n### Integration Points\n- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n\n## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n\n### Command Specifications\n\n**`add <description>`**\n- Argument: description (string)\n- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n\n**`list`**\n- No arguments\n- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n\n**`complete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n\n**`delete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Remove todo from list\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n### Code Template\n```python\nimport click\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n## LAYER\n1\n\n## PARALLELIZATION\nParallel with: None\n\n## CONSTRAINTS\n- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n\n## VALIDATION\nAfter completion, verify manually:\n```bash\nuv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\nuv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. {"type":"assistant","message":{"model":"claude-opus-4-5-20251101","id":"msg_01SoDu8nGvXZFrguAmjeRZLM","type":"message","role":"assistant","content":[{"type":"tool_use","id":"toolu_01Cskg8VZFrZALauoBvqFhJn","name":"Write","input":{"file_path":"/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/src/todo_cli/cli.py","content":"\"\"\"Todo CLI - Command-line interface for managing todo items.\"\"\"\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\n\nimport click\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    \"\"\"Load todos from JSON file.\"\"\"\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    content = DATA_FILE.read_text()\n    if not content.strip():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(content)\n\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Save todos to JSON file.\"\"\"\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli() -> None:\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    if not description.strip():\n        click.echo(\"Error: Description cannot be empty\")\n        sys.exit(1)\n\n    todos = load_todos()\n    new_id = max((t['id'] for t in todos), default=0) + 1\n    new_todo = {\n        \"id\": new_id,\n        \"description\": description,\n        \"completed\": False,\n        \"created_at\": datetime.now().isoformat()\n    }\n    todos.append(new_todo)\n    save_todos(todos)\n    click.echo(f\"Added todo: {description}\")\n\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    if not todos:\n        click.echo(\"No todos yet\")\n        return\n\n    for todo in todos:\n        checkbox = \"[x]\" if todo['completed'] else \"[ ]\"\n        click.echo(f\"{todo['id']}. {checkbox} {todo['description']}\")\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    for todo in todos:\n        if todo['id'] == id:\n            todo['completed'] = True\n            save_todos(todos)\n            click.echo(f\"Completed todo: {todo['description']}\")\n            return\n\n    click.echo(\"Todo not found\")\n    sys.exit(1)\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    for i, todo in enumerate(todos):\n        if todo['id'] == id:\n            description = todo['description']\n            todos.pop(i)\n            save_todos(todos)\n            click.echo(f\"Deleted todo: {description}\")\n            return\n\n    click.echo(\"Todo not found\")\n    sys.exit(1)\n\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01Cskg8VZFrZALauoBvqFhJn","type":"tool_result","content":"File created successfully at: /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/src/todo_cli/cli.py"}]},"parent_tool_use_id":null,"session_id":"144c4aba-1700-4ecc-b265-f39bc875822c","uuid":"5e555bcf-2a3c-47ad-8411-c29c90b13ee2","tool_use_result":{"type":"create","filePath":"/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/src/todo_cli/cli.py","content":"\"\"\"Todo CLI - Command-line interface for managing todo items.\"\"\"\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\n\nimport click\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    \"\"\"Load todos from JSON file.\"\"\"\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    content = DATA_FILE.read_text()\n    if not content.strip():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(content)\n\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Save todos to JSON file.\"\"\"\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli() -> None:\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    if not description.strip():\n        click.echo(\"Error: Description cannot be empty\")\n        sys.exit(1)\n\n    todos = load_todos()\n    new_id = max((t['id'] for t in todos), default=0) + 1\n    new_todo = {\n        \"id\": new_id,\n        \"description\": description,\n        \"completed\": False,\n        \"created_at\": datetime.now().isoformat()\n    }\n    todos.append(new_todo)\n    save_todos(todos)\n    click.echo(f\"Added todo: {description}\")\n\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    if not todos:\n        click.echo(\"No todos yet\")\n        return\n\n    for todo in todos:\n        checkbox = \"[x]\" if todo['completed'] else \"[ ]\"\n        click.echo(f\"{todo['id']}. {checkbox} {todo['description']}\")\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    for todo in todos:\n        if todo['id'] == id:\n            todo['completed'] = True\n            save_todos(todos)\n            click.echo(f\"Completed todo: {todo['description']}\")\n            return\n\n    click.echo(\"Todo not found\")\n    sys.exit(1)\n\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    todos = load_todos()\n    for i, todo in enumerate(todos):\n        if todo['id'] == id:\n            description = todo['description']\n            todos.pop(i)\n            save_todos(todos)\n            click.echo(f\"Deleted todo: {description}\")\n            return\n\n    click.echo(\"Todo not found\")\n    sys.exit(1)\n\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n","structuredPatch":[],"originalFile":null}}

Implement `load_todos() -> list[dict]`:\n       - Return empty list if file doesn't exist\n       - Parse and return JSON content otherwise\n    5. Implement `save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None`:\n       - Write JSON with indent=2\n    6. Create Click group with `@click.group()` decorator\n    7. Implement `add` command:\n       - `@cli.command()` and `@click.argument('description')` decorators\n       - Validate non-empty description (if empty: `click.echo(\"Error: Description cannot be empty\")`, `sys.exit(1)`)\n       - Calculate next ID: `max(t['id'] for t in todos) + 1` or 1 if empty\n       - Create todo dict with id, description, completed=False, created_at (ISO 8601)\n       - Append to todos, save, output \"Added todo: {description}\"\n    8. Add `if __name__ == '__main__': cli()` at end\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:65-82` — Click CLI group pattern with decorators\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:85-98` — JSON storage pattern for load/save\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:101-109` — Todo data structure schema\n    - `PROMPT.md:63-111` — Full code template with all commands\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - CREATE: `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo add <description>`\n    - Output: \"Added todo: {description}\" on success\n    - Exit code: 0 on success, 1 if empty description\n    - Data schema: `{\"id\": int, \"description\": str, \"completed\": bool, \"created_at\": str}`\n    - File: `todos.json` created/updated in working directory\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: `todo add \"Buy groceries\"` → exits 0, shows \"Added todo: Buy groceries\"\n    - Edge case: `todo add \"\"` → exits 1, shows error message\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - `todos.json` created at runtime if not exists\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements for CLI tool\n\n  - **Risk:** Empty description passed as argument (Click allows it)\n      **Mitigation:** Explicit validation at start of `add()` function\n\n---\n\n- [X] **Item 2 — Implement List Command**\n  - **What to do:**\n    1. Add `list_todos` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Use `@cli.command('list')` (named 'list' because `list` is Python builtin)\n       - Function name: `list_todos()` to avoid shadowing\n       - Load todos, handle empty case: `click.echo(\"No todos yet\")`\n       - Format each todo: `{id}. [x] {description}` if completed, else `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n       - Use `click.echo()` for each line\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:129` — List output format specification\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:138` — Empty list message: \"No todos yet\"\n    - `PROMPT.md:47-49` — List command specification\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add list_todos command (~15 lines)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo list`\n    - Output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    - Empty list output: \"No todos yet\"\n    - Exit code: 0 (always succeeds)\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: After adding todo → shows `1. [ ] Task description`\n    - Edge case: Empty list → shows \"No todos yet\"\n    - Integration: After complete → shows `[x]` checkbox\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Read-only operation\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    N/A - No security concerns for list operation\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"No todos yet\" initially\n    uv run todo add \"Task 1\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1. [ ] Task 1\"\n    ```\n\n  - **Risks & Mitigations:**\n    - **Risk:** Using `list` as function name shadows Python builtin\n      **Mitigation:** Use `list_todos` as function name, `'list'` as command name in decorator\n\n---\n\n- [ ] **Item 3 — Implement Complete and Delete Commands**\n  - **What to do:**\n    1. Add `complete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - `@cli.command()` and `@click.argument('id', type=int)` decorators\n       - Load todos, find todo by ID\n       - If not found: `click.echo(\"Todo not found\")`, `sys.exit(1)`\n       - Set `completed = True`, save todos\n       - Output: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    2. Add `delete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Same pattern: find by ID, handle not found\n       - Remove from list, save todos\n       - Output: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:136-137` — Invalid ID handling: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    - `PROMPT.md:51-61` — Complete and delete command specifications\n    - `PROMPT.md:97-108` — Code template for complete/delete\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add complete and delete commands (~25 lines total)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo complete <id>` where id is integer\n    - CLI command: `todo delete <id>` where id is integer\n    - Success output: \"Completed todo: {description}\" / \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    - Error output: \"Todo not found\"\n    - Exit codes: 0 on success, 1 if ID not found\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path complete: Add task, complete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Happy path delete: Add task, delete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Edge case: `complete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n    - Edge case: `delete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Modifies existing data file\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    - Input validation: Click enforces integer type for ID argument\n    - Validate ID exists in data before modifying\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo add \"Test task\"\n    uv run todo complete 1        # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1. [x] Test task\"\n    uv run todo delete 1          # Should show \"Deleted todo: Test task\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"No todos yet\"\n    uv run todo complete 999      # Should show \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    uv run todo delete 999        # Should show \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    ```\n\n  - **Risks & Mitigations:**\n    - **Risk:** Non-integer ID passed (e.g., `complete abc`)\n      **Mitigation:** Click's `type=int` handles this with automatic error message\n    - **Risk:** ID type mismatch when comparing (int vs str from JSON)\n      **Mitigation:** JSON stores integers correctly; ensure comparison uses same types\n\n---\n\n- [ ] **Item 4 — Final Verification and Linting**\n  - **What to do:**\n    1. TASKΩ depends on this: Final validation will test all CLI commands\n  - Entry point in `pyproject.toml` references `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n\n## Diff Test Plan\n**Changed files/symbols:**\n- `src/todo_cli/cli.py`: `load_todos`, `save_todos`, `cli`, `add`, `list_todos`, `complete`, `delete`\n\n**Test coverage (to be validated in TASK2):**\n| Symbol | Happy Path | Edge Cases |\n|--------|------------|------------|\n| `add` | Add valid description | Empty description |\n| `list_todos` | List existing todos | Empty list |\n| `complete` | Complete valid ID | Invalid ID |\n| `delete` | Delete valid ID | Invalid ID |\n| persistence | Data survives CLI invocations | N/A |\n| workflow | Add → Complete → List shows [x] | N/A |\n\n## Follow-ups\n- None identified\n\n\n## PREVIOUS TASKS CONTEXT FILES AND RESEARCH: \n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md\n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK0/CONTEXT.md\n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK0/RESEARCH.md\n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK0/TODO.md\n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK1/RESEARCH.md\n- /Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/TASK1/RESEARCH.md\n\n","structuredPatch":[{"oldStart":144,"oldLines":7,"newStart":144,"newLines":7,"lines":[" "," ---"," ","-- [ ] **Item 3 — Implement Complete and Delete Commands**","+- [X] **Item 3 — Implement Complete and Delete Commands**","   - Add `delete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Same pattern: find by ID, handle not found\n       - Remove from list, save todos\n       - Output: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:136-137` — Invalid ID handling: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    - `PROMPT.md:51-61` — Complete and delete command specifications\n    - `PROMPT.md:97-108` — Code template for complete/delete\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add complete and delete commands (~25 lines total)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo complete <id>` where id is integer\n    - CLI command: `todo delete <id>` where id is integer\n    - Success output: \"Completed todo: {description}\" / \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    - Error output: \"Todo not found\"\n    - Exit codes: 0 on success, 1 if ID not found\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path complete: Add task, complete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Happy path delete: Add task, delete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Edge case: `complete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n    - Edge case: `delete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Modifies existing data file\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    - Input validation: Click enforces integer type for ID argument\n    - Validate ID exists in data before modifying\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo add \"Test task\"\n    uv run todo complete 1        # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1. all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [ ] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n- [ ] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n- [ ] `todo --help` shows usage information (Click automatic)\n- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` with schema: `{id, description, completed, created_at}`\n- [ ] IDs auto-increment (max existing + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n- [ ] Code passes `uv run ruff check src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n\n## Impact Analysis\n- **Directly Implement `add` command:\n       - `@cli.command()` and `@click.argument('description')` decorators\n       - Validate non-empty description (if empty: `click.echo(\"Error: Description cannot be empty\")`, `sys.exit(1)`)\n       - Calculate next ID: `max(t['id'] for t in todos) + 1` or 1 if empty\n       - Create todo dict with id, description, completed=False, created_at (ISO 8601)\n       - Append to todos, save, output \"Added todo: {description}\"\n    8. Add `if __name__ == '__main__': cli()` at end\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:65-82` — Click CLI group pattern with decorators\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:85-98` — JSON storage pattern for load/save\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:101-109` — Todo data structure schema\n    - `PROMPT.md:63-111` — Full code template with all commands\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - CREATE: `src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo add <description>`\n    - Output: \"Added todo: {description}\" on success\n    - Exit code: 0 on success, 1 if empty description\n    - Data schema: `{\"id\": int, \"description\": str, \"completed\": bool, \"created_at\": str}`\n    - File: `todos.json` created/updated in working directory\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: `todo add \"Buy groceries\"` → exits 0, shows \"Added todo: Buy groceries\"\n    - Add `list_todos` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Use `@cli.command('list')` (named 'list' because `list` is Python builtin)\n       - Function name: `list_todos()` to avoid shadowing\n       - Load todos, handle empty case: `click.echo(\"No todos yet\")`\n       - Format each todo: `{id}. [x] {description}` if completed, else `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n       - Use `click.echo()` for each line\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:129` — List output format specification\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:138` — Empty list message: \"No todos yet\"\n    - `PROMPT.md:47-49` — List command specification\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add list_todos command (~15 lines)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo list`\n    - Output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    - Empty list output: \"No todos yet\"\n    - Exit code: 0 (always succeeds)\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: After adding todo → shows `1. Add `delete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Same pattern: find by ID, handle not found\n       - Remove from list, save todos\n       - Output: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:136-137` — Invalid ID handling: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    - `PROMPT.md:51-61` — Complete and delete command specifications\n    - `PROMPT.md:97-108` — Code template for complete/delete\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add complete and delete commands (~25 lines total)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo complete <id>` where id is integer\n    - CLI command: `todo delete <id>` where id is integer\n    - Success output: \"Completed todo: {description}\" / \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    - Error output: \"Todo not found\"\n    - Exit codes: 0 on success, 1 if ID not found\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path complete: Add task, complete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Happy path delete: Add task, delete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Edge case: `complete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n    - Edge case: `delete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Modifies existing data file\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    - Input validation: Click enforces integer type for ID argument\n    - Validate ID exists in data before modifying\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo add \"Test task\"\n    uv run todo complete 1        # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1. Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n     3→\n     4→## COMPLEXITY\n     5→Medium\n     6→\n     7→## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n     8→**For complete environment context, read:**\n     9→- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n    10→\n    11→**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n    12→\n    13→## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n    14→\n    15→### Files This Task Will Create\n    16→- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n    17→\n    18→### Patterns to Follow\n    19→- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n    20→- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n    21→- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n    22→  ```python\n    23→  {\n    24→      \"id\": 1,\n    25→      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n    26→      \"completed\": False,\n    27→      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n    28→  }\n    29→  ```\n    30→\n    31→### Integration Points\n    32→- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n    33→- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n    34→- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n    35→\n    36→## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n    37→\n    38→### Command Specifications\n    39→\n    40→**`add <description>`**\n    41→- Argument: description (string)\n    42→- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n    43→- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n    44→- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n    45→\n    46→**`list`**\n    47→- No arguments\n    48→- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n    49→- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n    50→\n    51→**`complete <id>`**\n    52→- Argument: id (integer)\n    53→- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n    54→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    55→- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    56→\n    57→**`delete <id>`**\n    58→- Argument: id (integer)\n    59→- Remove todo from list\n    60→- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    61→- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    62→\n    63→### Code Template\n    64→```python\n    65→import click\n    66→import json\n    67→import sys\n    68→from pathlib import Path\n    69→from datetime import datetime\n    70→\n    71→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    72→\n    73→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    74→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    75→        return []\n    76→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    77→\n    78→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    79→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    80→\n    81→@click.group()\n    82→def cli():\n    83→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    84→    pass\n    85→\n    86→@cli.command()\n    87→@click.argument('description')\n    88→def add(description: str) -> None:\n    89→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    90→    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n    91→\n    92→@cli.command('list')\n    93→def list_todos() -> None:\n    94→    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    95→    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n    96→\n    97→@cli.command()\n    98→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n    99→def complete(id: int) -> None:\n   100→    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n   101→    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n   102→\n   103→@cli.command()\n   104→@click.argument('id', type=int)\n   105→def delete(id: int) -> None:\n   106→    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n   107→    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n   108→\n   109→if __name__ == '__main__':\n   110→    cli()\n   111→```\n   112→\n   113→## LAYER\n   114→1\n   115→\n   116→## PARALLELIZATION\n   117→Parallel with: None\n   118→\n   119→## CONSTRAINTS\n   120→- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n   121→- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n   122→- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n   123→- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n   124→- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n   125→- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n   126→- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n   127→- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n   128→\n   129→## VALIDATION\n   130→After completion, verify manually:\n   131→```bash\n   132→uv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\n   133→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [ ] Test task\"\n   134→uv run todo complete 1                # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n   135→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. [x] Test task\"\n   136→uv run todo delete 1                  # Should show \"Deleted todo: Test task\"\n   137→uv run todo list                      # Should show \"No todos yet\"\n   138→uv run todo add \"\"                    # Should error, exit 1\n   139→uv run todo complete 999              # Should show \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   140→```\n   141→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. Handle all edge cases with appropriate error messages and exit codes.\n\n## COMPLEXITY\nMedium\n\n## CONTEXT REFERENCE\n**For complete environment context, read:**\n- `/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/.claudiomiro/AI_PROMPT.md` - Contains full tech stack, CLI patterns, data structure, acceptance criteria, and constraints\n\n**You MUST read AI_PROMPT.md before executing this task to understand the environment.**\n\n## TASK-SPECIFIC CONTEXT\n\n### Files This Task Will Create\n- `src/todo_cli/cli.py` - Main CLI implementation (~80-120 lines)\n\n### Patterns to Follow\n- Click CLI group pattern: AI_PROMPT.md:65-82\n- JSON storage pattern (load_todos, save_todos): AI_PROMPT.md:85-98\n- Todo data structure: AI_PROMPT.md:101-109\n  ```python\n  {\n      \"id\": 1,\n      \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",\n      \"completed\": False,\n      \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n### Integration Points\n- Entry point in pyproject.toml points to `todo_cli.cli:cli`\n- `todos.json` is created in working directory at runtime\n- TASK2 tests will import from `todo_cli.cli import cli`\n\n## EXTRA DOCUMENTATION\n\n### Command Specifications\n\n**`add <description>`**\n- Argument: description (string)\n- Validation: reject empty description with error, exit 1\n- ID logic: max(existing_ids) + 1, or 1 if empty\n- Output: \"Added todo: {description}\"\n\n**`list`**\n- No arguments\n- Format: `{id}. [x] {description}` or `{id}. [ ] {description}`\n- Empty list: \"No todos yet\"\n\n**`complete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Find todo by ID, set `completed: true`\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n\n**`delete <id>`**\n- Argument: id (integer)\n- Remove todo from list\n- Not found: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- Success: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n### Code Template\n```python\nimport click\nimport json\nimport sys\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description: str) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: validation, ID generation, save, output\n\n@cli.command('list')\ndef list_todos() -> None:\n    \"\"\"List all todo items.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: load, format output, handle empty\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef complete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Mark a todo as completed.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('id', type=int)\ndef delete(id: int) -> None:\n    \"\"\"Delete a todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implement: find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n## LAYER\n1\n\n## PARALLELIZATION\nParallel with: None\n\n## CONSTRAINTS\n- IMPORTANT: Do not perform any git commit or git push.\n- Use Click for CLI (NOT argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (NOT print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory (use `Path(\"todos.json\")`)\n- Use ISO 8601 format: `datetime.now().isoformat()`\n- Do NOT over-engineer: no classes, no config system, no logging framework\n- Do NOT add features not in spec (no due dates, priorities, tags)\n\n## VALIDATION\nAfter completion, verify manually:\n```bash\nuv run todo add \"Test task\"          # Should show \"Added todo: Test task\"\nuv run todo list                      # Should show \"1. TASK2 can import `from todo_cli.cli import cli`\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n- [X] `todo add \"task description\"` creates new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n- [X] `todo list` displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [X] `todo complete <id>` marks specified todo as completed\n- [X] `todo delete <id>` removes specified todo from storage\n- [X] `todo --help` shows usage information (Click automatic)\n- [X] Todos stored in `todos.json` with schema: `{id, description, completed, created_at}`\n- [X] IDs auto-increment (max existing + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [X] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [X] Invalid ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [X] Invalid ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [X] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n- [X] Exit code 0 for success, 1 for errors\n- [X] Code passes `uv run ruff check src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n\n## Impact Analysis\n- **Directly impacted:**\n  - [ ] desc\" or \"No todos yet\"\n   - Test: `uv run todo list`\n\n5. **Implement complete command**\n   - Implement: Find by ID, update, save, handle not found\n   - Pattern from: PROMPT.md:97-101\n   - Output: \"Completed todo: {description}\" or \"Todo not found\"\n   - Test: `uv run todo complete 1`\n\n6. **Implement delete command**\n   - Implement: Find by ID, remove, save, handle not found\n   - Pattern from: PROMPT.md:103-108\n   - Output: \"Deleted todo: {description}\" or \"Todo not found\"\n   - Test: `uv run todo delete 1`\n\n7. **Add main block**\n   - Pattern from: PROMPT.md:109-110\n   - `if __name__ == '__main__': cli()`\n\n8. **Run verification**\n   - Full workflow per PROMPT.md:130-140\n   - Lint: `uv run ruff check src/todo_cli/cli.py`\n\n---\n\n**Research completed:** 2024-11-30\n**Total similar components found:** 2 (cli.py implementation, test_cli.py patterns)\n**Total reusable components identified:** 0 (creates new code, uses only stdlib + click)\n**Estimated complexity:** Low-Medium\n","numLines":268,"startLine":1,"totalLines":268}}}

Purpose\n     6→\n     7→**What:** Build a complete command-line todo application in Python with persistent JSON storage, proper CLI interface using Click, and comprehensive test coverage.\n     8→\n     9→**Why:** This is a foundational productivity tool demonstrating proper CLI design patterns, data persistence, and test-driven development in Python.\n    10→\n    11→**Success Definition:** A working `todo` CLI command that persists todos to JSON, handles all specified commands (`add`, `list`, `complete`, `delete`, `--help`), passes at least 10 tests, and handles edge cases gracefully with appropriate exit codes.\n    12→\n    13→---\n    14→\n    15→## 2. Environment & Codebase Context\n    16→\n    17→### Tech Stack\n    18→- **Language:** Python 3.11+\n    19→- **CLI Framework:** Click (use `click` package)\n    20→- **Testing:** pytest\n    21→- **Package Manager:** uv (NOT pip/poetry)\n    22→- **Build Config:** pyproject.toml with entry point\n    23→\n    24→### Project Structure (to be created)\n    25→```\n    26→t2_todo_cli/\n    27→├── .claudiomiro/          # Metadata (exists)\n    28→│   ├── AI_PROMPT.md       # This file\n    29→│   ├── INITIAL_PROMPT.md  # Original requirements\n    30→│   └── ...\n    31→├── src/\n    32→│   └── todo_cli/\n    33→│       ├── __init__.py    # Package init (version, exports)\n    34→│       └── cli.py         # Main CLI implementation\n    35→├── tests/\n    36→│   └── test_cli.py        # Test suite (10+ tests)\n    37→├── pyproject.toml         # Package config with entry point\n    38→└── todos.json             # Data file (created at runtime)\n    39→```\n    40→\n    41→### Working Directory\n    42→`/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/`\n    43→\n    44→### Package Manager Commands\n    45→```bash\n    46→uv add click              # Add Click dependency\n    47→uv add pytest --dev       # Add pytest as dev dependency\n    48→uv sync                   # Sync dependencies\n    49→uv run pytest             # Run tests\n    50→uv run todo               # Run CLI after install\n    51→```\n    52→\n    53→### Entry Point Configuration\n    54→The `pyproject.toml` must define a console script entry point:\n    55→```toml\n    56→[project.scripts]\n    57→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n    58→```\n    59→\n    60→---\n    61→\n    62→## 3. Related Code Context\n    63→\n    64→### Click CLI Pattern Reference\n    65→```python\n    66→import click\n    67→\n    68→@click.group()\n    69→def cli():\n    70→    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    71→    pass\n    72→\n    73→@cli.command()\n    74→@click.argument('description')\n    75→def add(description):\n    76→    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    77→    # Implementation here\n    78→    click.echo(\"Added: ...\")\n    79→\n    80→if __name__ == '__main__':\n    81→    cli()\n    82→```\n    83→\n    84→### JSON Storage Pattern\n    85→```python\n    86→import json\n    87→from pathlib import Path\n    88→from datetime import datetime\n    89→\n    90→DATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n    91→\n    92→def load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    93→    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n    94→        return []\n    95→    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n    96→\n    97→def save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    98→    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n    99→```\n   100→\n   101→### Todo Data Structure\n   102→```python\n   103→{\n   104→    \"id\": 1,                           # int, auto-incremented\n   105→    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",    # str, non-empty\n   106→    \"completed\": False,                # bool\n   107→    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"  # ISO 8601 timestamp\n   108→}\n   109→```\n   110→\n   111→---\n   112→\n   113→## 4. Acceptance Criteria\n   114→\n   115→### Core Commands\n   116→- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` — Creates a new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n   117→- [ ] `todo list` — Displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n   118→- [ ] `todo complete <id>` — Marks specified todo as completed (sets `completed: true`)\n   119→- [ ] `todo delete <id>` — Removes specified todo from storage\n   120→- [ ] `todo --help` — Shows usage information (Click provides this automatically)\n   121→\n   122→### Data Persistence\n   123→- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n   124→- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n   125→- [ ] IDs auto-increment (next ID = max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n   126→- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n   127→\n   128→### Output Format\n   129→- [ ] `list` output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n   130→- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n   131→- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n   132→- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n   133→\n   134→### Edge Case Handling\n   135→- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n   136→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   137→- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n   138→- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n   139→\n   140→### Testing Requirements\n   141→- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n   142→- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n   143→- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n   144→- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n   145→- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n   146→\n   147→### Code Quality\n   148→- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n   149→- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n   150→- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n   151→\n   152→---\n   153→\n   154→## 5. |\n   187→\n   188→### Constraints\n   189→\n   190→**DO:**\n   191→- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n   192→- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n   193→- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n   194→- Store todos.json in current working directory\n   195→- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n   196→\n   197→**DO NOT:**\n   198→- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n   199→- Create extra files beyond requirements\n   200→- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n   201→- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n   202→\n   203→### pyproject.toml Template\n   204→```toml\n   205→[project]\n   206→name = \"todo-cli\"\n   207→version = \"0.1.0\"\n   208→description = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\n   209→requires-python = \">=3.11\"\n   210→dependencies = [\n   211→    \"click>=8.0\",\n   212→]\n   213→\n   214→[project.scripts]\n   215→todo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n   216→\n 224→[dependency-groups]\n   225→dev = [\n   226→    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n   227→    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n   228→]\n   229→```\n   230→\n   231→---\n   232→\n   233→## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n   234→\n   235→### Test Categories Required\n   236→\n   237→**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n   238→1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n   239→2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n   240→3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n   241→4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n   242→\n   243→**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n   244→5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n   245→6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   246→7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n   247→8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n   248→\n   249→**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n   250→9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n   251→10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n   252→\n   253→### Test Pattern with Click\n   254→```python\n   255→from click.testing import CliRunner\n   256→from todo_cli.cli import cli\n   257→import tempfile\n   258→import os\n   259→\n   260→def test_add_todo():\n   261→    runner = CliRunner()\n   262→    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n   263→        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n   264→        assert result.exit_code == 0\n   265→        assert 'Added' in result.output\n   266→```\n   267→\n   268→### Test Isolation\n   269→- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n   270→- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n   271→- Each test must be independent\n   272→\n   273→---\n   274→\n   275→## 6. Verification and Traceability\n   276→\n   277→### Self-Verification Checklist\n   278→\n   279→Before marking complete, verify:\n   280→\n   281→**Commands:**\n   282→- [ ] `uv run todo add \"Test task\"` → Adds task, shows confirmation\n   283→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[ ]` status\n   284→- [ ] `uv run todo complete 1` → Shows completion message\n   285→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[x]` status\n   286→- [ ] `uv run todo delete 1` → Shows deletion message\n   287→- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows \"No todos yet\"\n   288→\n   289→**Edge Cases:**\n   290→- [ ] `uv run todo add \"\"` → Error message, exit 1\n   291→- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   292→- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n   293→\n   294→**Tests:**\n   295→- [ ] `uv run pytest` → All tests pass\n   296→- [ ] Test count >= 10\n   297→\n   298→**Linting:**\n   299→- [ ] `uv run ruff check src/ tests/` → No errors\n   300→\n   301→### Traceability Matrix\n   302→\n   303→| Requirement | Implementation | Test |\n   304→|-------------|----------------|------|\n   305→| add command | cli.py:add() | test_add_todo |\n   306→| list command | cli.py:list() | test_list_todos |\n   307→| complete command | cli.py:complete() | test_complete_todo |\n   308→| delete command | cli.py:delete() | test_delete_todo |\n   309→| --help | Click automatic | N/A |\n   310→| JSON storage | load_todos/save_todos | test_persistence |\n   311→| Empty description error | add() validation | test_add_empty_description |\n   312→| Invalid ID error | complete()/delete() | test_complete_invalid_id, test_delete_invalid_id |\n   313→| Empty list message | list() | test_list_empty |\n   314→\n   315→---\n   316→\n   317→## 7. Reasoning Boundaries\n   318→\n   319→### Follow These Patterns\n   320→- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n   321→- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n   322→- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n   323→\n   324→### Do Not Over-Engineer\n   325→- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n   326→- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n   327→- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n   328→- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n   329→\n   330→### When Uncertain\n   331→- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n   332→- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n   333→- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n   334→\n   335→---\n   336→\n   337→## Summary\n   338→\n   339→Build a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence. Four commands (add, list, complete, delete) plus help. Store todos in `todos.json` with id/description/completed/created_at fields. Handle errors gracefully with exit code 1. Write 10+ pytest tests covering happy paths and edge cases. Use uv for package management.\n   340→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. Purpose\n\n**What:** Build a complete command-line todo application in Python with persistent JSON storage, proper CLI interface using Click, and comprehensive test coverage.\n\n**Why:** This is a foundational productivity tool demonstrating proper CLI design patterns, data persistence, and test-driven development in Python.\n\n**Success Definition:** A working `todo` CLI command that persists todos to JSON, handles all specified commands (`add`, `list`, `complete`, `delete`, `--help`), passes at least 10 tests, and handles edge cases gracefully with appropriate exit codes.\n\n---\n\n## 2. Environment & Codebase Context\n\n### Tech Stack\n- **Language:** Python 3.11+\n- **CLI Framework:** Click (use `click` package)\n- **Testing:** pytest\n- **Package Manager:** uv (NOT pip/poetry)\n- **Build Config:** pyproject.toml with entry point\n\n### Project Structure (to be created)\n```\nt2_todo_cli/\n├── .claudiomiro/          # Metadata (exists)\n│   ├── AI_PROMPT.md       # This file\n│   ├── INITIAL_PROMPT.md  # Original requirements\n│   └── ...\n├── src/\n│   └── todo_cli/\n│       ├── __init__.py    # Package init (version, exports)\n│       └── cli.py         # Main CLI implementation\n├── tests/\n│   └── test_cli.py        # Test suite (10+ tests)\n├── pyproject.toml         # Package config with entry point\n└── todos.json             # Data file (created at runtime)\n```\n\n### Working Directory\n`/Users/administrator/projects/claude-quickstarts/autonomous-coding/benchmarks/results/claudiomiro/t2_todo_cli/`\n\n### Package Manager Commands\n```bash\nuv add click              # Add Click dependency\nuv add pytest --dev       # Add pytest as dev dependency\nuv sync                   # Sync dependencies\nuv run pytest             # Run tests\nuv run todo               # Run CLI after install\n```\n\n### Entry Point Configuration\nThe `pyproject.toml` must define a console script entry point:\n```toml\n[project.scripts]\ntodo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n```\n\n---\n\n## 3. Related Code Context\n\n### Click CLI Pattern Reference\n```python\nimport click\n\n@click.group()\ndef cli():\n    \"\"\"Todo CLI - Manage your tasks from the command line.\"\"\"\n    pass\n\n@cli.command()\n@click.argument('description')\ndef add(description):\n    \"\"\"Add a new todo item.\"\"\"\n    # Implementation here\n    click.echo(\"Added: ...\")\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    cli()\n```\n\n### JSON Storage Pattern\n```python\nimport json\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom datetime import datetime\n\nDATA_FILE = Path(\"todos.json\")\n\ndef load_todos() -> list[dict]:\n    if not DATA_FILE.exists():\n        return []\n    return json.loads(DATA_FILE.read_text())\n\ndef save_todos(todos: list[dict]) -> None:\n    DATA_FILE.write_text(json.dumps(todos, indent=2))\n```\n\n### Todo Data Structure\n```python\n{\n    \"id\": 1,                           # int, auto-incremented\n    \"description\": \"Buy groceries\",    # str, non-empty\n    \"completed\": False,                # bool\n    \"created_at\": \"2024-01-15T10:30:00\"  # ISO 8601 timestamp\n}\n```\n\n---\n\n## 4. Acceptance Criteria\n\n### Core Commands\n- [ ] `todo add \"task description\"` — Creates a new todo with auto-incremented ID, stores in JSON\n- [ ] `todo list` — Displays all todos with `[x]` for completed, `[ ]` for pending, numbered by ID\n- [ ] `todo complete <id>` — Marks specified todo as completed (sets `completed: true`)\n- [ ] `todo delete <id>` — Removes specified todo from storage\n- [ ] `todo --help` — Shows usage information (Click provides this automatically)\n\n### Data Persistence\n- [ ] Todos stored in `todos.json` in working directory\n- [ ] Each todo contains: `id` (int), `description` (str), `completed` (bool), `created_at` (ISO timestamp)\n- [ ] IDs auto-increment (next ID = max existing ID + 1, or 1 if empty)\n- [ ] Data persists between program runs\n\n### Output Format\n- [ ] `list` output format: `1. [x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n- [ ] Success messages: \"Added todo: ...\", \"Completed todo: ...\", \"Deleted todo: ...\"\n- [ ] Exit code 0 for successful operations\n- [ ] Exit code 1 for errors\n\n### Edge Case Handling\n- [ ] Empty description on `add` → Error message, exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `complete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Invalid/non-existent ID on `delete` → \"Todo not found\", exit code 1\n- [ ] Empty todo list on `list` → \"No todos yet\"\n\n### Testing Requirements\n- [ ] At least 10 tests in `tests/test_cli.py`\n- [ ] Tests cover all commands (add, list, complete, delete)\n- [ ] Tests cover edge cases (empty description, invalid ID, empty list)\n- [ ] Tests use Click's CliRunner for CLI testing\n- [ ] Tests use temporary files/directories for isolation\n\n### Code Quality\n- [ ] Code passes linting (ruff check)\n- [ ] Proper type hints on functions\n- [ ] Clean, readable code following PEP 8\n\n---\n\n## 5. Create `src/todo_cli/__init__.py`\n4. Initialize uv project and sync dependencies\n\n**Layer 1 — Core Implementation:**\n1. Implement `cli.py` with Click commands\n2. Implement JSON storage functions (load/save)\n3. Implement each command: add, list, complete, delete\n\n**Layer 2 — Testing:**\n1. Create `test_cli.py` with CliRunner tests\n2. Write tests for happy paths\n3. Write tests for edge cases\n\n**Layer 3 — Validation:**\n1. Run all tests\n2. Run linter\n3. Manual verification of CLI commands\n\n### Expected Artifacts\n\n| File | Purpose |\n|------|---------|\n| `pyproject.toml` | Package config, dependencies, entry point |\n| `src/todo_cli/__init__.py` | Package init with version |\n| `src/todo_cli/cli.py` | Main CLI implementation |\n| `tests/test_cli.py` | Test suite with 10+ tests |\n\n### Constraints\n\n**DO:**\n- Use Click for CLI (not argparse or typer)\n- Use `click.echo()` for output (not print)\n- Use `sys.exit(1)` or `raise SystemExit(1)` for errors\n- Store todos.json in current working directory\n- Use ISO 8601 format for timestamps (`datetime.now().isoformat()`)\n\n**DO NOT:**\n- Use pip/poetry (use uv only)\n- Create extra files beyond requirements\n- Over-engineer with classes if functions suffice\n- Add features not specified (no due dates, priorities, etc.)\n\n### pyproject.toml Template\n```toml\n[project]\nname = \"todo-cli\"\nversion = \"0.1.0\"\ndescription = \"A simple command-line todo application\"\nrequires-python = \">=3.11\"\ndependencies = [\n    \"click>=8.0\",\n]\n\n[project.scripts]\ntodo = \"todo_cli.cli:cli\"\n\n[build-system]\nrequires = [\"hatchling\"]\nbuild-backend = \"hatchling.build\"\n\n[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]\npackages = [\"src/todo_cli\"]\n\n[dependency-groups]\ndev = [\n    \"pytest>=7.0\",\n    \"ruff>=0.1\",\n]\n```\n\n---\n\n## 5.1 Testing Guidance\n\n### Test Categories Required\n\n**Happy Path Tests (minimum 4):**\n1. `test_add_todo` — Add a todo successfully, verify it exists\n2. `test_list_todos` — List todos shows correct format\n3. `test_complete_todo` — Mark todo complete, verify status change\n4. `test_delete_todo` — Delete todo, verify removal\n\n**Edge Case Tests (minimum 4):**\n5. `test_add_empty_description` — Empty description shows error\n6. `test_complete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n7. `test_delete_invalid_id` — Invalid ID shows \"Todo not found\"\n8. `test_list_empty` — Empty list shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Integration Tests (minimum 2):**\n9. `test_persistence` — Data persists across CLI invocations\n10. `test_complete_workflow` — Add → Complete → List shows [x]\n\n### Test Pattern with Click\n```python\nfrom click.testing import CliRunner\nfrom todo_cli.cli import cli\nimport tempfile\nimport os\n\ndef test_add_todo():\n    runner = CliRunner()\n    with runner.isolated_filesystem():\n        result = runner.invoke(cli, ['add', 'Buy groceries'])\n        assert result.exit_code == 0\n        assert 'Added' in result.output\n```\n\n### Test Isolation\n- Use `runner.isolated_filesystem()` for file isolation\n- OR use `tmp_path` fixture with environment variable to override data file location\n- Each test must be independent\n\n---\n\n## 6. Verification and Traceability\n\n### Self-Verification Checklist\n\nBefore marking complete, verify:\n\n**Commands:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"Test task\"` → Adds task, shows confirmation\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[ ]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 1` → Shows completion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows task with `[x]` status\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 1` → Shows deletion message\n- [ ] `uv run todo list` → Shows \"No todos yet\"\n\n**Edge Cases:**\n- [ ] `uv run todo add \"\"` → Error message, exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo complete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n- [ ] `uv run todo delete 999` → \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n\n**Tests:**\n- [ ] `uv run pytest` → All tests pass\n- [ ] Test count >= 10\n\n**Linting:**\n- [ ] `uv run ruff check src/ tests/` → No errors\n\n### Traceability Matrix\n\n| Requirement | Implementation | Test |\n|-------------|----------------|------|\n| add command | cli.py:add() | test_add_todo |\n| list command | cli.py:list() | test_list_todos |\n| complete command | cli.py:complete() | test_complete_todo |\n| delete command | cli.py:delete() | test_delete_todo |\n| --help | Click automatic | N/A |\n| JSON storage | load_todos/save_todos | test_persistence |\n| Empty description error | add() validation | test_add_empty_description |\n| Invalid ID error | complete()/delete() | test_complete_invalid_id, test_delete_invalid_id |\n| Empty list message | list() | test_list_empty |\n\n---\n\n## 7. Reasoning Boundaries\n\n### Follow These Patterns\n- Use Click decorators consistently (`@cli.command()`, `@click.argument()`)\n- Keep data functions pure (load_todos returns list, save_todos takes list)\n- Exit codes: 0 = success, 1 = error\n\n### Do Not Over-Engineer\n- No database abstraction layer — direct JSON file operations are fine\n- No configuration system — hardcode `todos.json` filename\n- No logging framework — use `click.echo()`\n- No todo class — dict is sufficient for this scope\n\n### When Uncertain\n- Check Click documentation for CLI patterns\n- Follow existing Python conventions (PEP 8)\n- Ask rather than assume for ambiguous requirements\n\n---\n\n## Summary\n\nBuild a Python CLI todo app using Click with JSON persistence. Four commands (add, list, complete, delete) plus help. Store todos in `todos.json` with id/description/completed/created_at fields. Handle errors gracefully with exit code 1. Write 10+ pytest tests covering happy paths and edge cases. Use uv for package management.\n","numLines":340,"startLine":1,"totalLines":340}}}

[x] Completed task` or `2. [ ] Pending task`\n    - Empty list output: \"No todos yet\"\n    - Exit code: 0 (always succeeds)\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path: After adding todo → shows `1. [ ] Task description`\n    - Edge case: Empty list → shows \"No todos yet\"\n    - Integration: After complete → shows `[x]` checkbox\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Read-only operation\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    N/A - No security concerns for list operation\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"No todos yet\" initially\n    uv run todo add \"Task 1\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1. [ ] Task 1\"\n    ```\n\n  - **Risks & Mitigations:**\n    - **Risk:** Using `list` as function name shadows Python builtin\n      **Mitigation:** Use `list_todos` as function name, `'list'` as command name in decorator\n\n---\n\n- [X] **Item 3 — Implement Complete and Delete Commands**\n  - **What to do:**\n    1. Add `complete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - `@cli.command()` and `@click.argument('id', type=int)` decorators\n       - Load todos, find todo by ID\n       - If not found: `click.echo(\"Todo not found\")`, `sys.exit(1)`\n       - Set `completed = True`, save todos\n       - Output: \"Completed todo: {description}\"\n    2. Add `delete` command to `src/todo_cli/cli.py`:\n       - Same pattern: find by ID, handle not found\n       - Remove from list, save todos\n       - Output: \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n\n  - **Context (read-only):**\n    - `AI_PROMPT.md:136-137` — Invalid ID handling: \"Todo not found\", exit 1\n    - `PROMPT.md:51-61` — Complete and delete command specifications\n    - `PROMPT.md:97-108` — Code template for complete/delete\n\n  - **Touched (will modify/create):**\n    - MODIFY: `src/todo_cli/cli.py` — Add complete and delete commands (~25 lines total)\n\n  - **Interfaces / Contracts:**\n    - CLI command: `todo complete <id>` where id is integer\n    - CLI command: `todo delete <id>` where id is integer\n    - Success output: \"Completed todo: {description}\" / \"Deleted todo: {description}\"\n    - Error output: \"Todo not found\"\n    - Exit codes: 0 on success, 1 if ID not found\n\n  - **Tests:**\n    Type: unit tests with pytest (validated in TASK2)\n    - Happy path complete: Add task, complete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Happy path delete: Add task, delete 1 → exits 0, shows confirmation\n    - Edge case: `complete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n    - Edge case: `delete 999` → exits 1, shows \"Todo not found\"\n\n  - **Migrations / Data:**\n    N/A - Modifies existing data file\n\n  - **Observability:**\n    N/A - No observability requirements\n\n  - **Security & Permissions:**\n    - Input validation: Click enforces integer type for ID argument\n    - Validate ID exists in data before modifying\n\n  - **Performance:**\n    N/A - No performance requirements\n\n  - **Commands:**\n    ```bash\n    # Manual test\n    uv run todo add \"Test task\"\n    uv run todo complete 1        # Should show \"Completed todo: Test task\"\n    uv run todo list              # Should show \"1.
